Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

See the results on PS1 for how this generates a proper error instead of running into a timeout as in PS1 of the dependency.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:17:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-30 14:53:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-11-30 18:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2017-11-30 06:43:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix handling of locked channels in access check

When a channels is being removed according to [1], the access check will
currently loop forever trying to get information for that channel,
ignoring the

You are not authorized to perform this operation.

message that chanserv is sending. Instead we shpuld fail on that
scenario.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html#renaming-an-irc-channel

Change-Id: I1fe813c16b243bf78dcc6af9ff385cf77087c388
'}, {'created': '2017-11-30 06:57:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix handling of locked channels in access check

When a channels is being removed according to [1], the access check will
currently loop forever trying to get information for that channel,
ignoring the

    You are not authorized to perform this operation.

message that chanserv is sending. Instead we should fail on that
scenario.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html#renaming-an-irc-channel

Depends-On: Ie7593223564b376f6bac072b7afc3449e90ea1f9
Change-Id: I1fe813c16b243bf78dcc6af9ff385cf77087c388
'}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of locked channels in access check

When a channels is being removed according to [1], the access check will
currently loop forever trying to get information for that channel,
ignoring the

    You are not authorized to perform this operation.

message that chanserv is sending. Instead we should fail on that
scenario.

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/irc.html#renaming-an-irc-channel

Depends-On: Ie7593223564b376f6bac072b7afc3449e90ea1f9
Change-Id: I1fe813c16b243bf78dcc6af9ff385cf77087c388

commit_message:
Shift shade IRC activity to openstack-sdks

As part of combining the teams, shift shade to #openstack-sdks.
Add the channel notifications from #openstack-shade that weren't
already in #openstack-sdks. Also, remove notifications from
the #openstack-infra channel.

Finally remove the channel from accessbot as it is already in
lockdown mode.

Change-Id: Ie7593223564b376f6bac072b7afc3449e90ea1f9

commit_message:
Deprecate os_region_name option

The os_region_name parameter is deprecated and will be removed in a
future release[1].

[1]http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/manila/tree/releasenotes/notes/remove-os-region-name-82e3cd4c7fb05ff4.yaml

Change-Id: I4a4263b1373df9e6642a2e16fe8a0059914748aa
Closes-Bug: #1734800

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Releasenotes are version independent, so remove version/release display.
This also allows to build the document without nova installed.

Change-Id: Iadb57089a866ef4b334670456a4116c245dbd968

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 05:18:53.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I7246147a649e836a7ce70518fee256bc20fe0d30
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I7246147a649e836a7ce70518fee256bc20fe0d30

needed.

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

I created a tox PR[1] to add native support for constraints.  The answer
was basically "use deps".

I tested it locally with shade and tox and it does indeed seem to do
what we want.  Use shade as a guinea pig before rolling this out wider.

[1] https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/pull/642

Change-Id: I450dd513d7e1f881db764b11dcd6f9072c0c369c
Depends-On: Id61ae52d48b28cfc2221cb556a1c1f7c6dfd60dd

commit_message:
Skip jobs for driverfixes branches

There were a few jobs added to driverfixes runs with the conversion
to zuulv3 that are not needed/wanted. The plan for these was to
limit to just pep8 and unit test checks.

Since exclusions can't be done on the project specific variants, this
adds the exclusions to the job definitions themselves. This should be
OK since currently the only users of driverfixes branches have the
same policy, and most of these do not make sense to run against
something like these branches.

One thing to note is I am limiting unit test runs to just the py27
job. We may want to think about changing this in the future, but
for now we only need one version run and, at least for these older
versions, py27 is the more prevalent environment.

Change-Id: I21b3a0b924709b319c0aa67347242aa806a47117

commit_message:
Encryption everywhere with IPSEC

This adds the blueprint for enabling service communication encryption
using IPSEC.

bp ipsec

Change-Id: If56c135dcd2727710b5aeecc5dbdd4b778c96451

commit_message:
check query param for server groups function

Add additional schema check for server groups query function,
as we need backward compatible those changes, here we don't do real
check and later a microversion need to be done to do the real check.

Part of blueprint json-schema-validation-for-query-param

Change-Id: I625af5a8fe09a9772079e893aa707b961c666d2a

commit_message:
Adds the user's project id to the VIP port creation

This brings Octavia in line with what n-lbaas does for VIP port and
allows a user to attach a FIP to the VIP port generated by Octavia.

Change-Id: Ib7e6374cad49a16a733dacb2ea1ca096d8c4e6e4

messages: [{'account_id': 26639, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26639, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nwrap commit msg'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 16:44:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auto-detect crash on monasca-setup when using load_oslo_configuration

monasca_setup.detection.utils.load_oslo_configuration() should ignore options to `from_cmd` that is not oslo.config built-in options. We are only interested in the options --config-file and --config-dir.

Change-Id: I0b84177c7b4954ebec9b8cec377c806e05741cc6
Story: 2001303
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auto-detect crash on monasca-setup when using load_oslo_configuration

monasca_setup.detection.utils.load_oslo_configuration() should ignore options to `from_cmd` that is not oslo.config built-in options. We are only interested in the options --config-file and --config-dir.

Change-Id: I0b84177c7b4954ebec9b8cec377c806e05741cc6
Story: 2001303

subject: Support setting of interface external-ids
messages:
[{'account_id': 27378, 'date': '2017-11-28 20:51:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-11-28 20:51:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2017-11-29 09:17:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

It seems we haven't had test coverage for br_*_external_id methods, would you mind writing some functional test to cover those methods? Or at least the two new methods in impl_idl. The tests should be part of this class: https://github.com/openstack/ovsdbapp/blob/master/ovsdbapp/tests/functional/schema/open_vswitch/test_impl_idl.py#L32"}, {'account_id': 27378, 'date': '2017-11-29 19:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sure, will do'}, {'account_id': 27378, 'date': '2017-11-29 21:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2017-11-29 22:02:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27378, 'date': '2017-11-29 22:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:44:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Nobody likes using the generic functions like db_get/db_set. I'd like to avoid having separate commands for each object that has external_ids, but if we're going to have them then this is the way to go. :p"}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:07:21.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I9de3d89dabe7819464adadc053bdbb0968124a29
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I9de3d89dabe7819464adadc053bdbb0968124a29

[{'created': '2017-11-29 14:23:28.000000000', 'message': 'Partially Revert "Updated release note toward Queens release."

There is no need to create an index page for an unreleased series.
The release job will automatically propose this kind of changes
when a stable branch is cut. Until Queens release, two pages has
same contents and it has no meaning.

This partially reverts commit de6c37377d6d645de96c5317697a02dea9ee0e96.

Change-Id: Ie37f06308633b09445ea551e880dbf9dddbf6574
'}]
commit_message:
Partially Revert "Updated release note toward Queens release."

There is no need to create an index page for an unreleased series.
The release job will automatically propose this kind of changes
when a stable branch is cut. Until Queens release, two pages has
same contents and it has no meaning.

This partially reverts commit de6c37377d6d645de96c5317697a02dea9ee0e96.

Change-Id: Ie37f06308633b09445ea551e880dbf9dddbf6574

commit_message:
Images: Cinder service specific explicit image names

This PS makes the service-specific images for Cinder have
explicit names, allowing simple over-riding of images for an
entire site.

Change-Id: Id9d9de1185fa2545e40e096b3f355c17be1fe5c5

commit_message:
Add support for running helm tests for charts

Adds a common-helm-test task executed as part of the
deploy-helm-packages playbook. It allows the ability to run helm
tests against a chart by including a helm_test key in the chart
definition

Change-Id: I52bd5ca2fafa4eb704369590f7903c127133b090

commit_message:
Fix the format command-line

The command-line should be marked follow [1]
as consistent with their semantic meaning.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/rst-conv/inline-markups.html#command

Change-Id: Icb6aec0598cd8e575e26fa05c342b56cf6f81591

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-01 05:32:33.000000000', 'message': 'NaNJSONEncoder should be used in api "cinder/tenantabsolutelimits"

In api "cinder/tenantabsolutelimits", result maybe contains Infinity values,
but Infinity values are not supported by JSON standard, so NaNJSONEncoder is
needed here.

commit_message:
NaNJSONEncoder should be used in api "cinder/tenantabsolutelimits"

In api "cinder/tenantabsolutelimits", result maybe contains Infinity values,
but Infinity values are not supported by JSON standard, so NaNJSONEncoder is
needed here.

Change-Id: I750637e3214ad46a8b29e1ad565870cdcb827fe1
Closes-bug: #1714417

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 04:27:57.000000000', 'message': "Add missing 'autospec' to unit tests - /unit/objects/

Proposing adding [H210] hacking check in tox.ini to require autospec,
spec, or spec_set in mock.patch/mock.patch.object calls.

This patch adds missing 'autospec' or 'spec_set' to unit tests in
/tests/unit/objects/.

By using autospec=True assert errors can be caught. [H210] requires that some
value for autospec, spec, or spec_set is defined. It could be autospec=False.

More patches to follow to cover all the unit tests to enable [H210] in
tox.ini.

Change-Id: I142b49b092520d453b85db25c2c5f197ff85f3eb
"}, {'created': '2017-11-02 22:53:03.000000000', 'message': "Add missing 'autospec' to unit tests - /unit/objects/

Proposing adding [H210] hacking check in tox.ini to require autospec,
spec, or spec_set in mock.patch/mock.patch.object calls.

This patch adds missing 'autospec' or 'spec_set' to unit tests in
/tests/unit/objects/.

By using autospec=True assert errors can be caught. [H210] requires that some
value for autospec, spec, or spec_set is defined. It could be autospec=False.

More patches to follow to cover all the unit tests to enable [H210] in
tox.ini.

Change-Id: I142b49b092520d453b85db25c2c5f197ff85f3eb
"}, {'created': '2017-11-09 17:17:17.000000000', 'message': "Add missing 'autospec' to unit tests - /unit/objects/

Proposing adding [H210] hacking check in tox.ini to require autospec,
spec, or spec_set in mock.patch/mock.patch.object calls.

This patch adds missing 'autospec' or 'spec_set' to unit tests in
/tests/unit/objects/.

By using autospec=True assert errors can be caught. [H210] requires that some
value for autospec, spec, or spec_set is defined. It could be autospec=False.

autospec=True doesn't work on staticmethods: https://bugs.python.org/issue23078
For those cases, using spec_set=types.FunctionType.

More patches to follow to cover all the unit tests to enable [H210] in
tox.ini.

Change-Id: I142b49b092520d453b85db25c2c5f197ff85f3eb
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing 'autospec' to unit tests - /unit/objects/

Proposing adding [H210] hacking check in tox.ini to require autospec,
spec, or spec_set in mock.patch/mock.patch.object calls.

This patch adds missing 'autospec' or 'spec_set' to unit tests in
/tests/unit/objects/.

By using autospec=True assert errors can be caught. [H210] requires that some
value for autospec, spec, or spec_set is defined. It could be autospec=False.

autospec=True doesn't work on staticmethods: https://bugs.python.org/issue23078
For those cases, using spec_set=types.FunctionType.

More patches to follow to cover all the unit tests to enable [H210] in
tox.ini.

Change-Id: I142b49b092520d453b85db25c2c5f197ff85f3eb

Please set work flow -1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2017-10-04 14:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Neutron-lbaas does not have an API, it runs as an extension to neutron.  The oslo policy for neutron-lbaas is enforced in neutron here: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/policy_enforcement.py
This means that the policy-in-code should be done in the neutron code base for neutron-lbaas. There should be no changes here.
If you disagree please reply on this patch and chat with us in the #openstack-lbaas channel.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2017-10-04 19:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2017-10-05 08:40:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Neutron-lbaas does not have an API, it runs as an extension to
 > neutron.  The oslo policy for neutron-lbaas is enforced in neutron
 > here: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/policy_enforcement.py
 > This means that the policy-in-code should be done in the neutron
 > code base for neutron-lbaas. There should be no changes here.
 > If you disagree please reply on this patch and chat with us in the
 > #openstack-lbaas channel.

IMO, we does not only check policy on API but also anywhere we need to check context again.

For instance, I saw that we are checking it at some point in neutron-lbaas [1]. 

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lbaas/blob/e44ef6d95f95254461a45d2089c901041c3f7adf/neutron_lbaas/agent/agent_manager.py#L62

And IIUC, neutron-lbass will check policies again in itself code base.

                                                     + +
                                                     | | requests
                                                     | |
                                                     v v

                +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
                |                                 Neutron API: check policies                      |
                |                                                                                  |
                |                                                                                  |
Check policies again                                                                               |
         +      |                                                                                  |
         |      |    +---------------------------+    +--------------------------------------+     |
         |      |    |                           |    |                                      |     |
         |      |    |     neutron-lbaas         |    |            neutron-lib               |     |
         |      |    |                           |    |                                      |     |
         |      |    | import neutron_lib.context|    |                                      |     |
         +------------>and call check policiees  +--> |    load policies from json file with |     |
                |    |                           |    |    file path get from cfg.CONF       |     |
                |    |                           |    |                                      |     |
                |    |                           |    |                                      |     |
                |    |                           |    |                                      |     |
                |    +---------------------------+    +--------------------------------------+     |
                |                                                                                  |
                +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+



I would say sorry if I misunderstand at any point and please let me know, thanks.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2017-10-05 15:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The line you referenced is for neutron-lbaas to get a context to use when accessing other services/agents, it is not doing policy enforcement.

My point is all of the policy definition should be done inside the neutron code base neutron/neutron-lib as it is today.'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2017-10-06 01:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The line you referenced is for neutron-lbaas to get a context to
 > use when accessing other services/agents, it is not doing policy
 > enforcement.
 > 
 > My point is all of the policy definition should be done inside the
 > neutron code base neutron/neutron-lib as it is today.

 > The line you referenced is for neutron-lbaas to get a context to
 > use when accessing other services/agents, it is not doing policy
 > enforcement.
 > 
 > My point is all of the policy definition should be done inside the
 > neutron code base neutron/neutron-lib as it is today.

Gotcha, very thank you.'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2017-10-06 01:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Should be implemented in neutron/neutron-lib'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2017-10-06 02:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Just want to reconfirm at some points'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2017-10-06 02:50:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Michael Johnson, I just thought about the way that we load polices in case of we deploy neutron-lbaas in a separate node - A with neutron-server. Then neutron-lbaas will load policies in /etc/neutron/policy.json in A node.

I know we do not check policies in this project but we will load it own policies in neutron-lbaas codebase. It's quite similar with Octavia [1] (of course, we call RPC to neutron-lbaas instead of via API like Octavia IIRC)

And another thing, these rules [2] only for neutron-lbaas, right? if that, we need to define the default rules into neutron-lbaas codebase, not in neutron-lib or neutron (like Octavia gain).

Please give me you opinion about this, thanks!

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/policies/__init__.py
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lbaas/blob/master/etc/neutron/policy.json.sample"}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2017-10-06 03:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No need this change, I have understand the situation[1].
[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-lbaas/%23openstack-lbaas.2017-10-06.log.html#t2017-10-06T02:50:10'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2017-11-30 15:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > use when accessing other services/agents, it is not doing policy
 > enforcement.
 >

 > neutron code base neutron/neutron-lib as it is today.

Thanks for the information here, Michael. Much appreciated!'}]

commit_message:
Implement policy in code (1)

This commit prepare for implementing policies in code[1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

Depends-On: I6755eb077057b39e2df49575bf4f1545b9030905

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html

Change-Id: Ied466098ad0659493411c93b352dd832c00e5ec0

Javier, I already went down that road once (see my Jun 26 comment) and decided it doesn't lead anywhere. The painful lesson that I learned is that the majority of packages here are not using master tarballs yet, so they cannot meet the requirements of new master-based packages etc.

I'd have to migrate all the packages listed as requirements to master, and then their requirements and so on to make this work. This is an elaborated effort that needs to be done in an organized fashion, starting with leaf packages and then gradually further down the dependency tree."}, {'account_id': 22595, 'date': '2017-09-08 12:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 22595, 'date': '2017-09-08 12:29:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Tom, Thank you for your explanation to zuul(-1)
Actually, this change is the fix for bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1730529 as well.
Current manila does not support security access(https) api server, Pike version just provided configuration options in doc file, but does not implement.
``ssl_ca_file`` = ``None``
``ssl_key_file`` = ``None``
``ssl_cert_file`` = ``None``
This change just use the common way to pass use_ssl(true/false) from manila.conf to oslo_service.wsgi.Server, and also config ssl section in conf file.
[ssl]
``key_file`` = ``KEY_FILE``
``cert_file`` = ``CERT_FILE``'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2017-11-17 14:34:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add ssl support for manila API access

Currently, Manila does not support secure access the manila
APIs, obviously, this is a defect for manila service. This
change is to add ssl support for manila project.

Closes-bug: #1732844
Closes-bug: #1730529
Change-Id: I2dbc52ce95933e648cc065b2b2112788bf4484d0

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-06 20:10:07.000000000', 'message': "Set regex flag on ostestr command for osprofiler tests

In the unit test tox jobs we run the whole test suite first and after
that exits successfully we also run the osprofiler tests while setting
an osprofiler env variable to enable osprofiler. However the regex isn't
being set properly in ostestr, you set the selection regex with the
--regex flag. [1] This only works by chance because ostestr will pass
any unrecognized args to the subprocess used to run testr internally,
and testr leverages that as a regex. But in the latest os-testr release
it doesn't subprocess internally anymore and this doesn't work. This
commit fixes things to properly set the regex in ostestr so it works in
both old and new versions.

The order of the test runs is also switched because we capture the last
test run's subunit for openstack-health and other analysis, so we want
to full test run to be used for this.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/os-testr/latest/user/ostestr.html#test-selection

Change-Id: I890505d65ca6043ddbdcc5895f2620391b505756
(cherry picked from commit ce8ffc5303305a56e568206c851cd9e78649be5e)
"}]
commit_message:
Set regex flag on ostestr command for osprofiler tests

In the unit test tox jobs we run the whole test suite first and after
that exits successfully we also run the osprofiler tests while setting
an osprofiler env variable to enable osprofiler. However the regex isn't
being set properly in ostestr, you set the selection regex with the
--regex flag. [1] This only works by chance because ostestr will pass
any unrecognized args to the subprocess used to run testr internally,
and testr leverages that as a regex. But in the latest os-testr release
it doesn't subprocess internally anymore and this doesn't work. This
commit fixes things to properly set the regex in ostestr so it works in
both old and new versions.

The order of the test runs is also switched because we capture the last
test run's subunit for openstack-health and other analysis, so we want
to full test run to be used for this.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/os-testr/latest/user/ostestr.html#test-selection

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 06:11:13.000000000', 'message': 'Corrected the json-schema to comply with the spec

Some of the output fields did not match with the json-schema spec, we
had fields and classes that are not added to the schema output.
Added temporary handling, and we should revisit this and see if there is
any other better solution for that.

Change-Id: I9c6acc3dde0016f67ffe29ff602953055826c25b
Partial-Bug: #1734146
'}]
commit_message:
Corrected the json-schema to comply with the spec

Some of the output fields did not match with the json-schema spec, we
had fields and classes that are not added to the schema output.
Added temporary handling, and we should revisit this and see if there is
any other better solution for that.

Change-Id: I9c6acc3dde0016f67ffe29ff602953055826c25b
Partial-Bug: #1734146

commit_message:
Change the list notation on the UML output

Instead of different connector type, use the 1..* notation which is more
standard.
Also, changed the direction of the connector to the correct one.

Change-Id: I39758d4dac39cfa7ed4e24a60308252819eb2e3a
Partial-Bug: #1734146

commit_message:
Trivial change to trigger publish job

The publish job was broken.  pabelanger fixed it via [1].  This change
is just to trigger a republish so we get the changes from the last
couple of months.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/524001/

Change-Id: Ia48cd752963909f4df20d098b5d27e453403607f

messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-21 08:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-21 08:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

This is still WIP.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-24 08:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-24 08:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-24 11:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-24 11:56:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-24 12:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-24 18:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-27 16:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-28 09:50:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

This doesn't really improve the offline story, because we still rely on internet on the repo. But it's a way forward to help limited connectivity setups, so I am ok."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-28 09:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@JP The intent here is no necessarily focused on helping offline installs. Eventually it will, but there is a lot of change in a lot of places to get there. This is just one small step in that journey.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-29 16:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-30 13:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 08:29:48.000000000', 'message': "Implement pypiserver and pypi proxy cache

This patch implements nginx as a reverse proxy for python
packages. The initial query will be to a local deployment
of pypiserver in order to serve any locally built packages,
but if the package is not available locally it will retry

commit_message:
Implement pypiserver and pypi proxy cache

This patch implements nginx as a reverse proxy for python
packages. The initial query will be to a local deployment
of pypiserver in order to serve any locally built packages,
but if the package is not available locally it will retry
the query against pypi and cache the response.

Depends-On: Id20a43fed833d53ca0f147f517deafba6587352d
Change-Id: Ic4fd64f4dc82121a65088f3d7f4ae53f373df608
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
identity refactor for Pike and Chef 13

- implemented foodcritic and cookstyle corrections
- deprecated node.foo.bar method access for node['foo']['bar'] bracket access

Implements blueprint modern-chef

Change-Id: I5bf354498ea69888bda8aa46e04722e893367317

commit_message:
Disable offloading in test by default

We disable offloading in test for ubuntu this change does the same for
suse and cent. This should help resolve the kernel crashes and traces
we're seeing in the gate.

Change-Id: I6001a3b107c5679d8758aa35dc29a6fe6054e088
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Brilliant! I was considering adding a test for this on ansible or on infrared but this is the best place to add this test, so we avoid regressions.

I hope a shade hotfix will be released soon.'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

A fix for this is already committed. Just need a shade release.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2017-11-30 13:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think that we really need to test all ansible openstack modules that do use shade on shade because this would not happen with ansible.

So assuring that each new release of shade does not introduce regressions in ansible/os_* modules should be done.'}]

commit_message:
Fix in-tree version

The commit [1] updated all sources but didn't update the
version number in-tree. This should fix the inconsistency.

Note: After 16 rechecks due to timeouts, I've temporarily
increased the timeout for Pike. Other patchset should come
up with the solution than this one.

[1]: 1037cafa0bfdc414412190a7c968d5a860a24c89

Change-Id: Ic4b43adbd8517003ddb008746beb3ae7e6d45064

> How is this patch related to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307964/60/neutron/objects/router.py
 > ? It seems that the code is similar but not exactly same. Please
 > clarify.
Good day Ihar. As I mentioned in IRC meeting yesterday, this patch is built from scratch with our knowledge and investigation, only looked at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307964/60/neutron/objects/router.py for reference. 
We have some difference in fields and synthetic_fields with 4 attr "extra_attributes, route_list, attached_ports, l3_agents". Do they need to be in at this moment of Router creation? Or they could be inserted later in integration patch? 
Please let us know your opinion. Thanks a lot!'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-11-16 20:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I think foreign_keys may not be needed.'}, {'account_id': 26072, 'date': '2017-11-17 04:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26072, 'date': '2017-11-17 04:47:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Lighter ceph gates

Because heat and horizon are already tested in the main AIO build,
there is no reason to test it twice. Instead of we should simplify
each build to run faster.

I hope this will bring more success in the ceph gates.

Change-Id: I7045dce27891b1f47ecc793e19ca3a0d99149c02

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 21:33:34.000000000', 'message': 'Implement changes for pypi cache

In order to switch from having a repo server which
has all the python packages on it to a caching server
which *optionally* has packages on it, we make use of
a combination of pypiserver and nginx in a reverse
proxy configuration.

This patch implements the changes to ensure that we
are able to do pip installs in the repo_server role
and to transport the pypiserver logs via rsyslog to
the central log server.

Change-Id: Id20a43fed833d53ca0f147f517deafba6587352d
Depends-On: Ic4fd64f4dc82121a65088f3d7f4ae53f373df608
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

'}, {'created': '2017-11-24 16:38:47.000000000', 'message': "Allow pip_install to run in repo-server playbook

In order to switch from having a repo server which
has all the python packages on it to a caching server
which *optionally* has packages on it, we make use of
a combination of pypiserver and nginx in a reverse
proxy configuration.

This patch implements the changes to ensure that we
are able to do pip installs in the repo_server role
and to transport the pypiserver logs via rsyslog to
the central log server.

The pip_offline_install var is also set in group_vars
as it's used in group_vars, but is only set in the
pip_install role.

Change-Id: Id20a43fed833d53ca0f147f517deafba6587352d
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
"}]
commit_message:
Allow pip_install to run in repo-server playbook

In order to switch from having a repo server which
has all the python packages on it to a caching server
which *optionally* has packages on it, we make use of
a combination of pypiserver and nginx in a reverse
proxy configuration.

This patch implements the changes to ensure that we
are able to do pip installs in the repo_server role
and to transport the pypiserver logs via rsyslog to
the central log server.

The pip_offline_install var is also set in group_vars
as it's used in group_vars, but is only set in the
pip_install role.

Change-Id: Id20a43fed833d53ca0f147f517deafba6587352d
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 15:43:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix ValueError when loading old pci device record

Old pci_devices records might not have a uuid value set
and when we load those out of the database, the
PciDevice._from_db_object code was blindly trying to set
the PciDevice.uuid field to None, which fails because the
PciDevice.uuid field is not nullable.

This change fixes the problem by skipping the 'uuid' field
if it's not set in the db record so that we can auto-generate
a uuid later and update the object with it, which also performs
our online data migration.

This is similar to how we handle the uuid online migration for
other objects like compute nodes, services and migrations.

Change-Id: I5de0979e280004c1ce0acc99d69cc96089a704f8
Closes-Bug: #1735188
"}, {'created': '2017-11-29 17:50:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix ValueError when loading old pci device record

Old pci_devices records might not have a uuid value set
and when we load those out of the database, the
PciDevice._from_db_object code was blindly trying to set
the PciDevice.uuid field to None, which fails because the
PciDevice.uuid field is not nullable.

This change fixes the problem by skipping the 'uuid' field
if it's not set in the db record so that we can auto-generate
a uuid later and update the object with it, which also performs
our online data migration.

This is similar to how we handle the uuid online migration for
other objects like compute nodes, services and migrations.

Change-Id: I5de0979e280004c1ce0acc99d69cc96089a704f8
Closes-Bug: #1735188
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ValueError when loading old pci device record

Old pci_devices records might not have a uuid value set
and when we load those out of the database, the
PciDevice._from_db_object code was blindly trying to set
the PciDevice.uuid field to None, which fails because the
PciDevice.uuid field is not nullable.

This change fixes the problem by skipping the 'uuid' field
if it's not set in the db record so that we can auto-generate
a uuid later and update the object with it, which also performs
our online data migration.

This is similar to how we handle the uuid online migration for
other objects like compute nodes, services and migrations.

Change-Id: I5de0979e280004c1ce0acc99d69cc96089a704f8
Closes-Bug: #1735188

commit_message:
Send the horizon_url as the message parameter

This makes consuming it slightly easier as you only need to care about
the `status` and the `message` values.

Change-Id: I26bbeb99e2d65a523d482c7774f9591a6f79ccf8

commit_message:
Update Redirects documentation with 'whereto' info

Adds info about enabling CI testing of redirects using the 'whereto'
tool.  Also changes the example location for a .htaccess file to
reflect where the build-openstack-sphinx-docs job  expects to find
it in the gate.

Change-Id: I5d1f56ece7db977dd07aa414d74cf906939b300d
Closes-bug: #1730582

[{'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-09-14 08:38:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-09-14 08:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

I mark this change as Work-In-Progress (WIP) since we will have to wait for:
* my change Ie0f7f2d09355c3d2a9f7c5ee8f7e02dfea3b073b is merged
* oslo.log 2.21.0 is released
* oslo.log 2.21.0 can be required by oslo.serialization'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-14 10:11:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-oslo.log-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/04/504004/1/check/gate-oslo.log-docs-ubuntu-xenial/eec404b//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 59s
- gate-oslo.log-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/04/504004/1/check/gate-oslo.log-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/9454ede/ : SUCCESS in 3m 59s
- gate-oslo.log-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/04/504004/1/check/gate-oslo.log-python27-ubuntu-xenial/6ef462e/ : FAILURE in 3m 34s
- gate-oslo.log-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/04/504004/1/check/gate-oslo.log-python35/ca249dd/ : FAILURE in 3m 14s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/04/504004/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.log-ubuntu-xenial/8743097/ : SUCCESS in 1h 29m 47s
- gate-oslo.log-releasenotes http://docs-draft.openstack.org/04/504004/1/check/gate-oslo.log-releasenotes/4b4dcdf//releasenotes/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 26s
- gate-oslo.log-src-grenade-dsvm-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/04/504004/1/check/gate-oslo.log-src-grenade-dsvm-ubuntu-xenial-nv/42608d1/ : SUCCESS in 49m 06s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-09-25 14:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-25 14:22:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

This change depends on a change that failed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-09-25 14:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-10-25 15:18:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-10-25 15:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

First, I wanted to require oslo.serialization 2.21.1 or newer in requirements.txt, but such change is a pain for maintenance and planning upgrades.

I chose to only enable the fix if oslo.serialization 2.21.1 or newer is *detected at runtime*. It makes the code simpler to deploy.

This is how I fixed oslo.log in RHEL OSP (Red Hat flavor of OpenStack): detect if the fallback parameter is supported.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-10-25 15:41:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This fix looks OK as it is because it can be backported, but I think we should go ahead and raise the minimum required version of oslo.serialization in another patch and then remove the conditional.'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-10-26 08:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Doug: "but I think we should go ahead and raise the minimum required version of oslo.serialization in another patch and then remove the conditional."

JSONFormatter is not widely used, so I don't think that we should upgrade oslo.serialization minimum version in oslo.log just for that. I dislike playing the requirements dance.

Moreover, I'm not confortable to require a minor ".1" version: 2.21.1.

But I understand that you proposed to change the minimum version in a separated PR, right? You are free to do it on top of that if you want, you know better Oslo ecosystem than me :-) And I agree that this PR (in it current shape) is easy to backport.

I'm now waiting for your vote :-)'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-17 07:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-11-30 06:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2017-11-30 09:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
JSONFormatter convert unserializable with repr()

The JSONFormatter formatter now converts unserializable objects with
repr() to prevent JSON serialization errors on logging.

The fix requires oslo.serialization 2.21.1 or newer to get the new
fallback parameter of jsonutils.to_primitive().

Closes-Bug: #1593641
Change-Id: Ibda7d145af95903b2bf8d87113804350330a93b4

commit_message:
Set host name explicitly for telemetry

Without this there could be a mismatch with other services like
nova and neutron and ceilometer wont find nova instances.

Closes-bug: #1721054

Depends-On: I421a61dc31bd10fec0a10bf7e867001cf4dd3f02

Change-Id: I92f6d351931f1ea598d6a382704e8f986129be42
(cherry picked from commit efa7f8f515d1e35b32960c9564618cecb63020a6)
(cherry picked from commit 58b7e9ac759cfee38ef5c41f01be997fdcfbd121)
(cherry picked from commit bbca6c5a1f348466ab7cabe94cd18fe1f536400a)

commit_message:
snmp: warn if snmp call timeout

If the snmp call timeout because the host is unreachable
just warn the operator.

We can't really known what happen with the snmp error.
That's why the change just filter on "timeout" word.

Change-Id: I564b290c1e07882a7591a003c4da3ac6034ac794
(cherry picked from commit 988a2f3f2d6141711c63772024974b0da3cb646e)

commit_message:
snmp: warn if snmp call timeout

If the snmp call timeout because the host is unreachable
just warn the operator.

We can't really known what happen with the snmp error.
That's why the change just filter on "timeout" word.

Change-Id: I564b290c1e07882a7591a003c4da3ac6034ac794
(cherry picked from commit 988a2f3f2d6141711c63772024974b0da3cb646e)

commit_message:
Catch zaqar exception when no message to claim

On minor update, when the execution is still running
but there is no claim message anymore, we should
capture the zaqar exception to not print it to the
console

Change-Id: I802ffd553c54e4a4f9998420645aa078f508b9f0
Closes-Bug: #1734957

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-05 10:00:01.000000000', 'message': "Policy in code

This patch introduces the beginning implementation for registering
default policy rules in code. Default rules are defined under
cloudkitty.common.policies. Each API's policies are defined in a
sub-folder under that path and __init__.py contains all the
default policies in code which are registered in the ``init``
enforcer function in cloudkitty/common/policy.py.

The default rules for the info API was removed from the
policy.json and moved into code under
cloudkitty.common.policies.info. This can be gradually done
for the rest of the APIs in follow-up patches.

This commit does the following:
 - Creates the ``policies`` module that contains all the default
   policies in code.
 - Adds the base policy rules into code (context_is_admin,
   admin_or_owner and default rules).
 - Adds the info default policy module with default policy rules
   for the info API.
 - Add a tox env to generate default policy sample file

Partially Implements: blueprint policy-in-code

Change-Id: I3d9889c59f75db360815cf66004949b22085e123

commit_message:
Policy in code

This patch introduces the beginning implementation for registering
default policy rules in code. Default rules are defined under
cloudkitty.common.policies. Each API's policies are defined in a
sub-folder under that path and __init__.py contains all the
default policies in code which are registered in the ``init``
enforcer function in cloudkitty/common/policy.py.

The default rules for the info API was removed from the
policy.json and moved into code under
cloudkitty.common.policies.info. This can be gradually done
for the rest of the APIs in follow-up patches.

This commit does the following:
 - Creates the ``policies`` module that contains all the default
   policies in code.
 - Adds the base policy rules into code (context_is_admin,
   admin_or_owner and default rules).
 - Adds the info default policy module with default policy rules
   for the info API.
 - Add a tox env to generate default policy sample file

Partially Implements: blueprint policy-in-code

Change-Id: I3d9889c59f75db360815cf66004949b22085e123

commit_message:
Add the groundwork for musl profile support

At the moment all musl needs in addition to an official stage4 file is a
few keywords and use flag changes.

Change-Id: Ibf4a6d616aca1aef876967e2aa34170c96ac9ef8

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-25 03:44:33.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: resolve the error of VM_MISSING_PV_DRIVERS for PV VM

The error can be reproduced when unplug VM's VBD when booting VM.
Actually it's a race condition. At booting, it requires some time
for PV driver to be connected. It depends on which goes first for
the VBD.unplug and the PV driver being connected to xen.
The fix is to retry unplug. If really no PV driver installed in
VM, failed after the attempts.

Change-Id: I6b788ba24aa3e7c061dac06c52570ff3818bc91a
Closes-Bug: #1727134
"}, {'created': '2017-10-27 10:19:42.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: resolve the error of VM_MISSING_PV_DRIVERS for PV VM

The error can be reproduced when unplug VM's VBD when booting VM.
Actually it's a race condition. At booting, it requires some time
for PV driver to be connected. It depends on which goes first for
the VBD.unplug and the PV driver being connected to xen.
The fix is to retry unplug. If really no PV driver installed in
VM, failed after the attempts.

Change-Id: I6b788ba24aa3e7c061dac06c52570ff3818bc91a
Closes-Bug: #1727134
"}, {'created': '2017-10-28 09:28:55.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: resolve VBD unplug failure with VM_MISSING_PV_DRIVERS error

The virtual block device(VBD) hot unplugging should be done when VM has
paravirtualization(PV) driver installed. But we observed failures with
VM_MISSING_PV_DRIVERS error on a real PV VM sometime.

Actually it's a race condition. At VM booting, it needs some time for
the PV driver to be connected. If the VBD.unplug operation goes before
the PV driver connected to xen, it will failed with VM_MISSING_PV_DRIVERS.

The fix is to retry unplug. If really there is no PV driver installed in
VM, failed after the attempts.

Change-Id: I6b788ba24aa3e7c061dac06c52570ff3818bc91a
Closes-Bug: #1727134
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: resolve VBD unplug failure with VM_MISSING_PV_DRIVERS error

The virtual block device(VBD) hot unplugging should be done when VM has
paravirtualization(PV) driver installed. But we observed failures with
VM_MISSING_PV_DRIVERS error on a real PV VM sometime.

Actually it's a race condition. At VM booting, it needs some time for
the PV driver to be connected. If the VBD.unplug operation goes before
the PV driver connected to xen, it will failed with VM_MISSING_PV_DRIVERS.

The fix is to retry unplug. If really there is no PV driver installed in
VM, failed after the attempts.

Change-Id: I6b788ba24aa3e7c061dac06c52570ff3818bc91a
Closes-Bug: #1727134

commit_message:
Fix up fence_compute with latest keystone v3 changes

Via https://github.com/ClusterLabs/fence-agents/commit/549fee1c18cfb31881c9126ae46a4bd9b20b4716
the fence_compute RA gained the possibility to use keystone V3
authentication and versionless endpoint support.
Regenerate the manifest automatically given the new parameters

Tested this and am able to correctly configure fence_compute for
keystone v3:

[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# pcs stonith show stonith-fence_compute-fence-nova
 Resource: stonith-fence_compute-fence-nova (class=stonith type=fence_compute)
  Attributes: auth_url=http://10.0.0.4:5000/ domain=localdomain login=admin passwd=7mcDcuGDaBWcwNAbpwhjAZ4MB project_domain=Default record_only=1 tenant_name=admin user_domain=Default
  Meta Attrs: provides=unfencing
  Operations: monitor interval=60s (stonith-fence_compute-fence-nova-monitor-interval-60s)

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I40087dc602b92e06825c80d0c13c6036fdb77a52

commit_message:
rabbitmq: don't wait for message ack/requeue

I don't see any obvious reason why we should wait ack/requeue is done.

This waiter have already be removed from amqp1.

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.messaging/tree/oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/controller.py#n242

So, this change remove it from rabbitmq driver too.

Closes-bug: #1734788

Change-Id: I5ecedc762596181be19410b863851a0054fd6579

commit_message:
Harden the xinetd security

In galera_server role we allow anyone to know galera state, from
any network by default. We change this behavior here, to allow
only the nodes from galera_all and haproxy_all to query the
galera state.

Change-Id: Ieb3a8315a7599f850ba922da4c782230bd850125

commit_message:
Add dragonflow model printers - first stage

Add a parser for the dragonflow model and allow printing the model to
stdout. In the next stages we want to add different representations as
well: e.g. jsonschema, UML, etc.
This is a standalone app, currently not taking any argument. We will add
arguments in the future when more parsers will be added.

Change-Id: I6cb92a676ed7ecf2f23a9c1c4b18ecf57fa409d8
Partial-Bug: #1734146

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 04:58:21.000000000', 'message': 'Pre-install curl

As described, Fedora 27 has a curl-minimal package that comes in to
satisfy the rpm package dependency.  It conflicts with the "real" curl
package -- which is so commonly installed (by infra elements, etc)
that this becomes an annoying problem.  Just pre-install the full curl
package.

Fedora 24 is old enough to not worry about, so remove some old
workarounds to make the flow a little simpler.

Change-Id: I67baf96377109ac4521ba00243a0d91b35fafba0

commit_message:
Pre-install curl

As described, Fedora 27 has a curl-minimal package that comes in to
satisfy the rpm package dependency.  It conflicts with the "real" curl
package -- which is so commonly installed (by infra elements, etc)
that this becomes an annoying problem.  Just pre-install the full curl
package.

Fedora 24 is old enough to not worry about, so remove some old
workarounds to make the flow a little simpler.

Change-Id: I67baf96377109ac4521ba00243a0d91b35fafba0

commit_message:
Add cluster action to profile

This patch adds the abilities for profile to do cluster action
when create/delete a cluster. This action will only perform
once during cluster creation/deletion.

Change-Id: I7bde48b73f2b359a9032e36ea51e27d03146a936

commit_message:
Fix some reST field lists in docstrings

Probably the most common format for documenting arguments is reST field
lists [1]. This change updates some docstrings to comply with the field
lists syntax.

[1] http://sphinx-doc.org/domains.html#info-field-lists

Change-Id: Id2dea733bf467a8c0274f262cd130bac55ea2998

commit_message:
Install fedora-gpg-keys for F27

The repo GPG keys moved into a separate package [1] which now needs to
be installed.

Since the fedora-release/fedora-repos split is *long* since over,
remove that work-around and add this one.

[1] https://pagure.io/fedora-repos/c/f69f3729511c3eba5f470b1d90ea2bfee372eb29?branch=f27

Change-Id: I9ad28d5bdb78375ae21dbb16e2d8c4effb32cb35

commit_message:
Enable support for Gentoo overlays

This is intended to eventually support building musl-libc based images,
which need the musl overlay.

Change-Id: I8f5429ffa64e74c860772d9a00ff0b7eebb7721a

[{'created': '2016-12-09 05:47:48.000000000', 'message': "Enable cold migration with target host(3/3)

This function enables users to specify a target host
when cold migrating a VM instance.

This patch modifies the migration API.

APIImpact
DocImpact
    Add a 'host' parameter and 'force' parameter
    in the cold migration action.

commit_message:
Enable cold migration with target host(2/2)

This function enables users to specify a target host
when cold migrating a VM instance.

This patch modifies the migration API.

APIImpact
    Add an optional parameter 'host' in cold migration action.

Change-Id: Iee356c4dd097c846b6ca8617ead6a061300c83f8
Implements: blueprint cold-migration-with-target-queens

[{'created': '2017-11-22 16:26:05.000000000', 'message': 'Handle deprecation of inspect.getargspec

getargspec has been deprecated in py3 with plans to remove it in py3.6.
The recommendation is to move to inspect.signature, but the results
of that call are different than the existing one.

There is also getfullargspec available under py3 that was originally
deprecated, but for the sake of handling 2/3 code, it has been
un-deprecated. This call uses signature internally, but returns a mostly
compatible result with what getargspec did. This handles getargspec
deprecation by just using getfullargspec instead if it is available.

Change-Id: I32dd29bde99f9d59c2b0e14dd6782162963b43ae
'}, {'created': '2017-11-27 20:56:13.000000000', 'message': 'Handle deprecation of inspect.getargspec

The recommendation is to move to inspect.signature, but the results

There is also getfullargspec available under py3 that was originally

commit_message:
Handle deprecation of inspect.getargspec

getargspec has been deprecated in py3 with plans to remove it in py3.6.
The recommendation is to move to inspect.signature, but the results
of that call are different than the existing one.

There is also getfullargspec available under py3 that was originally
deprecated, but for the sake of handling 2/3 code, it has been
un-deprecated. This call uses signature internally, but returns a mostly
compatible result with what getargspec did. This handles getargspec
deprecation by just using getfullargspec instead if it is available.

Change-Id: I32dd29bde99f9d59c2b0e14dd6782162963b43ae

commit_message:
snmp: warn if snmp call timeout

If the snmp call timeout because the host is unreachable
just warn the operator.

We can't really known what happen with the snmp error.
That's why the change just filter on "timeout" word.

Change-Id: I564b290c1e07882a7591a003c4da3ac6034ac794

commit_message:
Fix 500 from image-import on queued images

If you run image-import api on any image which is in queued state having
valid container-format and disk-format set will return 500 error as it
raises IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'/tmp/staging/567bfb61-d9f7-47e5-aa1a-90b7797e70be'. The reason is image
does not have data stored in staging area.

Restricted transition from queued to importing state and returned HTTP 409
conflict error to the user.

Change-Id: I3d3ab283fd0faf4b63365ff2dbeb714913f02b27
Closes-Bug: #1733813

commit_message:
Move wait_for_interface_status into _check_interface

1.Move wait_for_interface_status into _check_interface.

2.In the case of test_reassign_port_between_servers, before check
iface['port_id'] and delete_interface, it is better to wait for the
status of port reach to active.

Change-Id: I9e185543da91d159709a2b773bab3945f4e79947

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 00:57:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix functional tests for MacOS

The patch for rescanning the PCI bus if the network interface is not found
in the amphora had bad functional tests that looked for the actual file to
be present.
This path is not present on MacOS so the functional test would fail when
run on MacOS hosts.

Change-Id: I5e9f8636ce6752fece1c0275d68043985d1fc86b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix functional tests for MacOS

The patch for rescanning the PCI bus if the network interface is not found
in the amphora had bad functional tests that looked for the actual file to
be present.
This path is not present on MacOS so the functional test would fail when
run on MacOS hosts.

Change-Id: I5e9f8636ce6752fece1c0275d68043985d1fc86b

(1 comment)

IMO we should not enable multiattach for the reference LVM driver at least until the current Nova/Cinder attach API work is completed, even if LVM should support this.

But, it isn't enough to say "LVM" should support this, since there are multiple iSCSI targets that can be used with this driver.  We also need gate jobs testing this for at least the scsi-target-utils and LIO targets to ensure it works correctly.  I'm not sure if anyone has looked into that.'}, {'account_id': 21897, 'date': '2017-11-06 15:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21897, 'date': '2017-11-06 15:37:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
LVM should support multiattach volume

When cinder volume driver is lvm, this patch makes sure that
a multiattach volume can be created successfully.

Change-Id: If697e93c0a3d4528a9b2ae6b5c84872affd05a91
Closes-Bug: #1729201

subject: Check keypair after rebuild server
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12033, 'name': 'DellEMC XtremIO CI', 'email': 'emc.xio.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-xio-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17130, 'name': 'melissaml', 'email': 'ma.lei@99cloud.net', 'username': 'malei'}, {'_account_id': 20190, 'name': 'zhufl', 'email': 'zhu.fanglei@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'zhufl'}, {'_account_id': 21897, 'name': 'lianghao', 'email': 'lianghao@cmss.chinamobile.com', 'username': 'cloud-liang'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 21897, 'date': '2017-11-03 06:12:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21897, 'date': '2017-11-03 06:13:37.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to check_keypair'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2017-11-03 17:11:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2017-11-03 17:44:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21897, 'date': '2017-11-03 23:50:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

Keypair is not transmit to recreate_server,and get from validation_resources
cls.server_id = cls.recreate_server(None, validatable=True)
if 'key_name' not in kwargs:
    try:
        kwargs['key_name'] = validation_resources['keypair']['name']
    except KeyError:
        LOG.debug("No key provided.")

Authentication is by validation_resources['keypair']['private_key'] 		
linux_client = remote_client.RemoteClient(
          self.get_server_ip(rebuilt_server, validation_resources),
          self.ssh_user,
          password,
          validation_resources['keypair']['private_key'],
          server=rebuilt_server,
          servers_client=self.client)
linux_client.validate_authentication()

Hi Ken'ichi Ohmichi,thanks for your review,https://developer.openstack.org/api-guide/compute/server_concepts.html is not mention keypair.
It is also not mention flavor,from above I think keypair should be the same.'}, {'account_id': 21897, 'date': '2017-11-03 23:53:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21897, 'date': '2017-11-03 23:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

thanks,have modified.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2017-11-21 02:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21897, 'date': '2017-11-22 02:55:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

Hi zhufl, I don't think it should be mention in the api ref,because key_name can be set in rebuild request.
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/
key_name (Optional)	body	string	
Key pair name for rebuild API. If null is specified, the existing keypair is unset.

However Server ID and IP addresses can't be change,so it should be remain the same.
(Use this function to remove all data on the server and replaces it with the specified image. Server ID and IP addresses remain the same.)

But in the test environment of tempest,when we rebuild the server,we not change the key_name,after finish  rebuilding,I think the key_name should be same as before."}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2017-11-22 05:13:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I feel the note[1] says that a keypair is the same after rebuilding implicitly. And it makes sense to me. But I also think we shouldn't make a test from an implementation only. So, I'd like to know Nova's definition before +2 on this.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#id64"}, {'account_id': 21897, 'date': '2017-11-30 06:49:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Change-Id: Id778eb35ac12aba342c8a3b16007b2d2d4a233f7
'}, {'created': '2017-11-03 23:53:23.000000000', 'message': 'Check keypair after rebuild server

When finish rebuilding server,the keypair should be same as before.

Change-Id: Id778eb35ac12aba342c8a3b16007b2d2d4a233f7
'}]
commit_message:
Check keypair after rebuild server

When finish rebuilding server,the keypair should be same as before.

Change-Id: Id778eb35ac12aba342c8a3b16007b2d2d4a233f7

Deprecate the keymgr_api_class input parameter and replace with new
keymgr_backend option. This mimics an equivalent set of changes in
puppet-cinder and puppet-nova, which were driven by a similar change

commit_message:
Fix use of deprecated "api_class" key manager option

Deprecate the keymgr_api_class input parameter and replace with new
keymgr_backend option. This mimics an equivalent set of changes in
puppet-cinder and puppet-nova, which were driven by a similar change
in Castellan's key manager options.

The deprecated value is still supported for backward compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1732998
Change-Id: I5036c8de9a429f22e1828b4e37735f4aa47bd858

commit_message:
Introduces puppet module for `/etc/login.defs`

Enables management of shadow password directives in login.defs

By allowing operators to set values in login.defs, they are able
to improve password security for newly created system accounts.

This change will in turn allow operators to adhere with security
hardening frameworks, such as STIG DISA & CIS Security Benchmarks.

bp login-defs

Change-Id: Iec8c032adb44593da3770d3c6bb5a4655e463637

commit_message:
Missing cherry-picking stop condition for swift services.

The cherry-pick at
I16f38d9e1042c5d83455a28882b4a024aac27699
missed adding the condition of serviced
enabled before stopping the service.

Partial-Bug: #1704389

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 14:35:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix glance config generation when using NFS

This commit sets the 'tripleo::glance::nfs_mount::edit_fstab' variable
to false to prevent the glance_api to write to /etc/fstab and fail in
the case we're using an NFS backend.

This also updates the NFS mount option and mount point to align with
the config from the puppet-tripleo module at:

https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/glance/nfs_mount.pp

Change-Id: Ied27fac67d28b3104441ada469942a19e3c07a89
Closes-Bug: #1732928
(cherry picked from commit 64854af783ca76fd95c2296a18fbead4bb0410cd)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix glance config generation when using NFS

This commit sets the 'tripleo::glance::nfs_mount::edit_fstab' variable
to false to prevent the glance_api to write to /etc/fstab and fail in
the case we're using an NFS backend.

This also updates the NFS mount option and mount point to align with
the config from the puppet-tripleo module at:

https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/master/manifests/glance/nfs_mount.pp

Change-Id: Ied27fac67d28b3104441ada469942a19e3c07a89
Closes-Bug: #1732928
(cherry picked from commit 64854af783ca76fd95c2296a18fbead4bb0410cd)

commit_message:
Add DeployIdentifier to Nova discover hosts container

Resolves an issue during scale out where the Nova init
container that runs discover hosts wasn't executing on a Heat
stack update if the container name and configs all stayed the same.

Change-Id: Ie2ecd3dbddb1cf3ee5bba6f7b33e11bc9b6b8b4e
Closes-bug: 1733966
(cherry picked from commit 263ea5e95c9e6067d03b07baa04b50df0d08754e)

commit_message:
Use 'NeutronTenantNetwork' instead of 'NeutronApiNetwork' for ovn-encap-ip

ovn::controller:ovn-encap-ip is used by OVN Controllers as Geneve tunnel
end points. Presently this is configured with 'NeutronApiNetwork'. Since
the VM traffic is forwarded through the geneve end points, it makes more
sense to use 'NeutronTenantNetwork'. In the case of ML2OVS deployments,
'NeutronTenantNetwork' is used as VxLAN/GRE endpoints. Hence reusing the
same param.

Change-Id: I8b8d8c2bf20697cfb5df6a9cadadc965ae03bbb4
Closes-bug: #1731892
(cherry picked from commit 2f12c9c750ef7be1e81f1803f335ce0434d150d2)

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Neutron]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

(cherry picked from 29be469a7370ccd5132f5268f2659a5269fa79ce)
Change-Id: Ie437b6825cc2c9a92a59d4a98e37d09e5e432a50
Partial-Bug: #1704389

commit_message:
Set the default CephAnsiblePlaybook to use into the env files

This will make sure that any scale up attempt is executed using
the site-docker.yml playbook.

Change-Id: I54796b70d4dbb26c41651171fae937a50852ef7d
Closes-Bug: #1734114
(cherry picked from commit fbb3dd9f9cdc07cb9db7320be09ebedfffb58b08)

commit_message:
Mount /var/cache/swift across containers

This is needed to ensure all containers update the same cache file used
by swift-recon to collect health and debug data.

Closes-Bug: 1734268
Change-Id: Ia586cc6277359dcb1a78194d65eaa932dd995ed3
(cherry picked from commit 079c0ff67ab8a7a5cc65702d27eb1fe3ac80325e)

commit_message:
Disable test_dscp_marking_packets fullstack test case

We disable test cases that are known to fail in attempt to get the
fullstack job pass and be able to make it voting.

Change-Id: If44a758bc7e81277437373569c3a39332bcd9bde
Related-Bug: #1733649

commit_message:
Make list_targets_by_instance look up IPv4 address as target

Previously list_targets_by_instance extracts the first IP address
of a network port. There is no guarantee that the first IP address
is IPv4 address. It may be an IPv6 address, but IPv6 cannot be used
as a target of floating IP.

Closes-Bug: #1725656
Change-Id: Ibd958dde42731aec2a2d80c0d172b7bfbb5c954e

commit_message:
Drop unused floating_ip_target_get_by_instance

floating_ip_target_get_by_instance is no longer used anywhere.
floating_ip_target_list_by_instance covers this functionality,
so there is no reason to keep this method.

Related-Bug: #1725657
Change-Id: I166acdcd555ba001b5802397b0092cb8065f9f27

commit_message:
Make preinstall.d more deterministic

Reorders the preinstall, making the order more explicit.  Also dedupes
some folder setup.

Change-Id: I423dcba169558ff6037a3382b997675722e77405

commit_message:
FIP associate: Show only ports from a target server

Previously when associating an FIP to a server, neutron ports which
do not belong to a target server were also shown in the target list.
It is clearer if only neutron ports connected to a target server
are shown. This commit changes the logic to lookup FIP targets to
achieve this.

Closes-Bug: #1630412
Change-Id: I9901b54e125b6bf09df86537c8308b2bfb1499f2

commit_message:
Disable metadata switch if only one item is available

Single metadata item on image details looks like action button,
which is confusing, so change cursor from pointer to default.

Closes-Bug: #1731884
Change-Id: I50b9a9c3878866249561a58c92aeafff4dffc949
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I68610483c55c915182f81910e4aea650c629d118

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I6c2a52ccc0e40ab36b9a33c9fbace8b4ea3bbb42

commit_message:
Dockerhub publisher job

This patchset contains two patches.

1. This patchset includes pushing mechanism for daily periodic jobs.
   (cherry picked from commit c506e626e7443fb95180807013082fb281390376)

2. Fixup small bug with dockerhub publisher
   Jinja2 vs gotpl...
   (cherry picked from commit 9674e2da1c1e0c5efffdace8e12849912210e197)

Change-Id: Ic4179ffd3a6e640abfb181dbd000bc75cc64b750

[{'created': '2017-07-14 05:21:03.000000000', 'message': 'Commonize load-edit directive

load-edit directive is placing under horizon/static/framework/widgets.
load-edit should be commonized, but it has code inside for
Instance creation workflow.

If load-edit will be commonized, we can use it for Key Pair importing,
Orchestration Template and Environment in stack creation.
Furthermore, plugins can use load-edit. e.g. cert file uploading in
Magnum UI, cluster spec yaml registering in Senlin Dashboard, etc.

This patch fixes the issue.

Also, at the point view from UX, file input element should be
above of textarea. Because user wants to load file at first,
rather than input directly.

Change-Id: I3e1befb81996841820111558adf3ca386709904d
Closes-Bug: #1704260

commit_message:
Commonize load-edit directive

Codes for load-edit directive is placing under framework directory:
horizon/static/framework/widgets
But it has code inside for Instance creation workflow.
This should be commonized.

If load-edit will be commonized, we can use it for Key Pair importing,
Orchestration Template and Environment in stack creation.
Furthermore, plugins can use load-edit. e.g. cert file uploading in
Magnum UI, cluster spec yaml registering in Senlin Dashboard, etc.

This patch fixes the issue.

Also, at the point view from UX, file input element should be
above of textarea. Because user wants to load file at first,
rather than input directly.

Change-Id: I3e1befb81996841820111558adf3ca386709904d
Closes-Bug: #1704260

commit_message:
Update Percona XtraDB Backup version

This is the time of the cycle where we update all the static
elements in the roles.
This version is defined staticly, so we bump it.
QPress has no updated package.
Suse has no definition for those packages.

Change-Id: I0af27722a0d7f2a3c3c0a456a0c60512e36a5728

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 16:55:24.000000000', 'message': "elements: zypper-minimal: Refresh repositories where necessary

We should always refresh the Tumbleweed repositories and the 'update'
one for Leap in order to always have the latest information from the
repositories.

Change-Id: I85db9d8bb7fa153f01222129e9b36fecc2632f57
"}]
commit_message:
elements: zypper-minimal: Refresh repositories where necessary

We should always refresh the Tumbleweed repositories and the 'update'
one for Leap in order to always have the latest information from the
repositories.

Change-Id: I85db9d8bb7fa153f01222129e9b36fecc2632f57
