[{'created': '2017-11-02 01:31:13.000000000', 'message': 'Check if 'files' variable is actually a list

The issue was noticed during packaging:
"""
Exception occurred:
  File "/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/openstack_dashboard/utils/\
    settings.py", line 263, in get_xstatic_dirs
    for file in files:
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
"""

It happens due to 'None' values in BASE_XSTATIC_MODULES
list.

Change-Id: Iaf6282819c26c12ca24d19ef7dee00a5c8586418
'}, {'created': '2017-11-13 11:26:33.000000000', 'message': 'Replace 'None' values with empy lists

As was discussed in the comments to change request 517149 [1]
it was decided that exception in get_xstatic_dirs function
should arise in case of 'None' values in BASE_XSTATIC_MODULES list.

In this change request all 'None' values were replaced with empty
lists to avoid exceptions during package build:
"""
Exception occurred:

TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable

Generate lower case stack name

will complain.

(cherry picked from commit 336404c861dfde68ab15a3f66fce714ee4f12291)

[{'created': '2017-11-28 22:38:15.000000000', 'message': "Port wiki bugs pages (1 of ?)

This is the first in a series of patches to port pages related to Bugs
from the OpenStack wiki to project-team-guide.

This patch ports https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Bugs

The original content is preserved, warts and all.  (There are some known
errata; they will be fixed in subsequent patches.)  Existing links to
other wiki pages are preserved for now - they'll need to be updated in
subsequent patches that port the referenced pages.

Change-Id: I870aae068d4166c9818a85bcdb77f16e12c28bba
"}, {'created': '2017-11-29 14:46:10.000000000', 'message': "Port wiki bugs pages (1 of ?)

This is the first in a series of patches to port pages related to Bugs
from the OpenStack wiki to project-team-guide.

This patch ports https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Bugs

In the process of porting the data, the following changes were made:

- Our use of Launchpad states is updated ('Fix Released' is set when a
  fix is merged; 'Fix Committed' is not used).
- Project-specific links to bug reporting landing pages are removed as
  being hard to keep current, and out of scope for the project team
  guide.
- The Bug list maintainers section is removed, likewise.

Change-Id: I870aae068d4166c9818a85bcdb77f16e12c28bba
"}]
commit_message:
Port wiki bugs pages (1 of ?)

This is the first in a series of patches to port pages related to Bugs
from the OpenStack wiki to project-team-guide.

This patch ports https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Bugs

In the process of porting the data, the following changes were made:

- Our use of Launchpad states is updated ('Fix Released' is set when a
  fix is merged; 'Fix Committed' is not used).
- Project-specific links to bug reporting landing pages are removed as
  being hard to keep current, and out of scope for the project team
  guide.
- The Bug list maintainers section is removed, likewise.

Change-Id: I870aae068d4166c9818a85bcdb77f16e12c28bba

subject: [DO NOT REVIEW] update_port() to ignore the original_port parameter
messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-09 16:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-09 16:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-09 16:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-09 18:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-09 21:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-09 23:17:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck

failure at tempest-release unrelated to the patch (happened in create_port_postcommit) [0] http://logs.openstack.org/57/518757/5/check/networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release/51f0ab9/logs/screen-q-svc.txt.gz?level=ERROR#_Nov_09_22_00_54_286530'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-09 23:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-10 12:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-10 12:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-10 15:06:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11762, 'date': '2017-11-10 20:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

This might be a good idea, although I am not 100% sure if there will be any new issues. I would suggest to have test cases to cover some race situations when there are 2 parallel updates A and B, and assume A updates Neutron DB first.

Case 1) Comparison in B happens before A updates OVN-NB
Case 2) Comparison in A happens after B updates OVN-NB
...'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-11 11:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> This might be a good idea, although I am not 100% sure if there
 > will be any new issues. I would suggest to have test cases to cover
 > some race situations when there are 2 parallel updates A and B, and
 > assume A updates Neutron DB first.
 > 
 > Case 1) Comparison in B happens before A updates OVN-NB
 > Case 2) Comparison in A happens after B updates OVN-NB
 > ...

Hi han, thanks a lot for the review! I agree with the tests it would be good to have some regardless of this. 

This patch is just an experiment to see if we could use the data stored in OVNDB to create these deltas but, I think that for it to work the way we want to we would need a little more. I see two ways of doing this:

1. We need to move these comparison logics to inside the OVS Commands classes, that way, if something change and the transaction is retried the delta will be regenerated using the latest data in OVNDB. That way we could have that command to skip the update based on the revision numbers which also add a verify() in the external_ids.

2. Having the external lock to make sure the delta is created and the OVNDB is updated in a protected area free of race.

Is there any other option you see ?

Thanks for the review'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-29 16:49:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

already asserted that it works'}]

[DO NOT REVIEW] update_port() to ignore the original_port parameter

Create the deltas using the information stored in OVNNB instead of
original_port.

Change-Id: I2781a7919b89c7bdfcbb8be778701762590a9f20

entire site.

commit_message:
Multi-region support in shared Keystone service deployment

Currently, Horizon does not support login with specified region in
shared-keystone, multi-region deployment, the existing
AVAILABLE_REGIONS only works with multi-keystone, multi-region
environment. This patch provides end user the ability to select
region when log in Horizon. A new setting called
'OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_REGION_CHOICES' is introduced in Horizon config
file (in a following patch). The 'AVAILABLE_REGIONS' setting takes
precedence over 'OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_REGION_CHOICES'.

Implements: blueprint horizon-multi-region-support
Change-Id: I7e7ffdc8a56dad9aa114497f982b035e521060aa

[{'created': '2017-11-29 13:45:39.000000000', 'message': "Allow the loading of modules with undefined pattern

If a user wanted to load a module which is not shipped

file) but is installed at the system with an external package he
couldn't because ansible requires a pattern like the patterns we can
find at the /boot/config-<kernel_version> file.

without a pattern

commit_message:
Fix the loading of modules with undefined pattern

We introduced the ability to use an undefined pattern in the
"Load kernel module task", but we also test the absence of
patterns in a previous task.

That task doesn't handle an undefined pattern.
This patch allows the user to load a module which is not shipped
with the distro, therefore not included in the
``/boot/config-<kernel_version> file``.

With this patch, we allow the loading of a module only by name,
without a pattern.

Change-Id: Iaed1afe728a239c5794e4fbe815f798ccd6a8d82
Signed-off-by: Dimitrios Markou <mardim@intracom-telecom.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

Getting contents of templates auto-generated, provided as args, scattered around, is not a trivial for users. So this to help them to answer the popular question we're used to ask when helping with troubleshooting: "What is the overcloud deploy command you're using?" The command basically does not help much as we need contents as well.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2017-11-28 10:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-28 11:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

related change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/448209/
we need to figure out what to do with the deployment plan as well.
But this as is probably helps a little bit at least for quick CI debugging'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-28 11:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

shardy: as a first (for follow-up patches) step we could just save all the user environments to the plan, including those generated with quickstart.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-28 11:09:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-28 11:18:32.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Let's instead add a flag to tripleoclient  that dumps all the files, not only those that aren't j2 rendered. If we also saved the plan in CI, I think we'd have all the information to debug template related issues. Thanks shardy!"}]

commit_message:
Validate the target directory exists before linking.

If you run the script manually and export the target release to another tag, it
might generate a broken link, this ensure the target exists.

Change-Id: Ia18bd7796f5f48c42ad9c23e917ddb37aa8103b3

commit_message:
Add New in Pike note to using db_sync check

This change adds a note (*New in Pike*) to the section for running
db_sync --check to clarify which release this feature was added. This
is similar to other sections in this document that specify the release
that a feature was added in and when it is available.

Change-Id: I7d778fa249997bb24e4563d6960910b93637bbf2
Closes-Bug: #1734549

commit_message:
Increase code coverage

Covers v2/shell.py:do_message_delete().

This change checks for raising an error only if all messages
failed to be found (or deleted).

Change-Id: I838fdbc7904220f3139f284746ddb859b434066c
Partial-Bug: #1364800

subject: Use cached auth_ref instead of gettin a new one each time
messages: [{'account_id': 14676, 'date': '2017-11-21 08:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-11-24 03:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nThanks Kairat, looking good.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 08:18:11.000000000', 'message': 'Use cached auth_ref instead of gettin a new one each time

The commit fixes an issue in renewing connections to Swift in case
if a given token is about to expire soon. get_auth_ref() returned
 a new auth_ref each time it was called so the will_expire_soon()
 call was useless since it always returned False. Now the cached
auth_ref property is used instead.
Closes-Bug:#1733502

Change-Id: I6cb53aec6798f965cf2a120d4f676a43bca5046a
'}]
commit_message:
Use cached auth_ref instead of gettin a new one each time

The commit fixes an issue in renewing connections to Swift in case
if a given token is about to expire soon. get_auth_ref() returned
 a new auth_ref each time it was called so the will_expire_soon()
 call was useless since it always returned False. Now the cached
auth_ref property is used instead.
Closes-Bug:#1733502

Change-Id: I6cb53aec6798f965cf2a120d4f676a43bca5046a

commit_message:
Fix tests that were changing settings but not reverting

There were two tests that modified settings but did not revert them
to their original setting after. This patch makes them use the config
fixture so they will be cleaned up after the test ends.

Change-Id: I15a7519401d8c04e472458979b04d7e2c0f00e82

commit_message:
Images: Congress service specific explicit image names

This PS makes the service-specific images for Congress have
explicit names, allowing simple over-riding of images for an
entire site.

Change-Id: I699c51cfbf7653336274337fa6c1203ff66770e7

It would be great if we can clean up ovs states as well when shutdown so that we can ensure there's no stale bridges or ports on ovs in the next deployment."}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-29 04:29:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> It would be great if we can clean up ovs states as well when
 > shutdown so that we can ensure there's no stale bridges or ports on
 > ovs in the next deployment.

You can only remove the DB when you *reboot* the host. Or if you properly `ovs-vsctl del-br` all the bridges and all other assests (to the point where you can `rmmod openvswitch`) so cleaning up is easier said than done.

But is possible"}, {'account_id': 15518, 'date': '2017-11-29 07:53:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2017-11-29 11:44:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2017-11-29 15:15:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-11-29 15:43:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2017-08-29 23:00:28.000000000', 'message': "Save updated libvirt domain XML after swapping volume

When a user calls the volume-update API, we swap_volume in the libvirt
driver from the old volume attachment to the new volume attachment.
Currently, we're saving the domain XML with the old configuration prior
to updating the volume and upon a soft-reboot request, it results in an
error:

  Instance soft reboot failed: Cannot access storage file <old path>

and falls back to a hard reboot, which is like pulling the power cord,
possibly resulting in file system inconsistencies.

This changes to saving the new, updated domain XML after the volume
swap.

Closes-Bug: #1713857

Change-Id: I166cde5ad8b00699e4ec02609f0d7b69236d855d

commit_message:
Save updated libvirt domain XML after swapping volume

When a user calls the volume-update API, we swap_volume in the libvirt
driver from the old volume attachment to the new volume attachment.
Currently, we're saving the domain XML with the old configuration prior
to updating the volume and upon a soft-reboot request, it results in an
error:

  Instance soft reboot failed: Cannot access storage file <old path>

and falls back to a hard reboot, which is like pulling the power cord,
possibly resulting in file system inconsistencies.

This changes to saving the new, updated domain XML after the volume
swap.

Closes-Bug: #1713857

Change-Id: I166cde5ad8b00699e4ec02609f0d7b69236d855d

commit_message:
Fix Kibana plugin config duplication

This commit fixes the problem of the Kibana plugin's instances
list getting appended to every time monasca-setup runs. See
the referenced story for details. It also adds a cautionary
note on avoiding the problem to plugin development
documentation.

Change-Id: I7c82028ad31798dcfe88e77c97c41da87c9743fa
Story: 2001311
Task: 5865

[{'created': '2017-11-16 15:21:50.000000000', 'message': "scripts: scripts-library.sh: Use pgrep -f to find the dstat process

The dstat process is actually a python script so running 'pgrep dstat'
will not match it

~# pgrep dstat
~# ps aux|grep dstat
root      5322  1.0  0.2  42888  8876 pts/0    S    16:16   0:00 python /usr/bin/dstat -tcmsdn --top-cpu --top-mem --top-bio --nocolor --output dstat.csv 3

However, we can use 'pgrep -f' to search for 'dstat' in the entire
procees string.

~# pgrep -f dstat
5322

Change-Id: I17c181bf957626cc11a1fe6f954e54c8abbfbd93

commit_message:
scripts: scripts-library.sh: Use pgrep -f to find the dstat process

The dstat process is actually a python script so running 'pgrep dstat'
will not match it

~# pgrep dstat
~# ps aux|grep dstat
root      5322  1.0  0.2  42888  8876 pts/0    S    16:16   0:00 python /usr/bin/dstat -tcmsdn --top-cpu --top-mem --top-bio --nocolor --output dstat.csv 3

However, we can use 'pgrep -f' to search for 'dstat' in the entire
procees string.

~# pgrep -f dstat
5322

Change-Id: I17c181bf957626cc11a1fe6f954e54c8abbfbd93

commit_message:
Make test_periodic_task.test_back_to_back_job more consistent

The test `test_back_to_back_job` was relying on a delay to get a
condition to happen. This created situations where the test did not pass
as a result of race conditions. This patch changes this to a set of
events that trigger the continuation of the test.

Change-Id: I98a3c9a3cdd6f12d6bcf2394b8dea455e0307b31

commit_message:
Pass bindep profiles matching tox environments

So that people can put things like:

  pypy [pypy]

or

  python3-dev-all [platform:dpkg py35]

into their bindep files, add bindep_profile variables to the tox jobs.

Change-Id: I7c22e23b73ddfc18ee28e87d34d1988417b49ccb

commit_message:
Add support for configured NAT source variable

In some clouds there are more than one potential NAT source and shade's
auto_ip can't figure it out propery. os-client-config added a config
option similar to nat_destination called nat_source to help people set a
config in such environments. Add support for it.

Change-Id: I4b50c2323a487b5ce90f9d38a48be249cfb739c5
Depends-On: I3d8dd6d734a1013d2d4a43e11c3538c3a345820b

commit_message:
Handle race condition deleting security group rule

It is possible that during the `_update_security_group_rules` operation,
the security group rule which is to be deleted gets removed by some
other external operation.   If this happens, it raises a NotFound
exception is not handled which can lead to a load balancer stuck in
a PENDING_DELETE status.

Depends-On: I97b52b80efb33749647229a55147a08afa112dd2
Change-Id: Ic9ebe8392758f3de5fc6a94f815f83d6de113188
Story: 2001300
Task: 5851

commit_message:
Run dstat in gate tests

This will enable dstat dumps at 3 second intervals in the background
during gate jobs. In the gate job exit tasks, dstat_graph[1] will be
used to generate an HTML compilation of the dstat data.

[1] https://github.com/Dabz/dstat_graph

Change-Id: I8475098a75528f8260a41f853a243b08296e3855
(cherry picked from commit af28cf025ba0ccbad8bca215de767fb97d0cc1c3)

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I96d9772d363305fd65119d1195cc25a508ec33dc

subject: Port wiki bugs pages (2 of ?)
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-11-28 23:27:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-11-28 23:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

i feel like this content will be in and out of date easily, why not just like to the tags in https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone ?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-29 11:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Yeah, I'd rather keep project-specific content out of the project team guide if possible.

The description of the various "official" tags should really live in the bugtracker itself. There isn't much we can do to get that feature in Launchpad, but we should make sure that StoryBoard gets it at some point. In the meantime I'm fine with that information living in the wiki if there is no better place for it.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:45:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What's the recommendation here?  I could:

1) Abandon this altogether and leave the content in the wiki.

2) Keep the `All projects` section follow it with a reference to the wiki page for project-specific tags."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:46:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I would keep it in the wiki for the time being, with an eye on moving it to StoryBoard so it can be automaintained on the tool.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Per ttx, keeping this content in the wiki.'}]

commit_message:
Port wiki bugs pages (2 of ?)

This is the second in a series of patches to port pages related to Bugs
from the OpenStack wiki to project-team-guide.

This patch ports https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Bug_Tags

The original content is preserved, warts and all.  (There are some known
errata; they will be fixed in subsequent patches.)  Existing links to
other wiki pages are preserved for now - they may need to be updated if
subsequent patches port the referenced pages.

Change-Id: Iac3cc2d9c0a0755c0545cc0573ab9e7c24493866

commit_message:
Fix Ansible 2.3 bump breaking virt task

As of Ansible 2.3, autostart is now an idempotent VM attribute instead
and should be called accordingly.

Depends-On: I62f8c1556c94c132215b760d9597488659762e6f
Change-Id: I96e4da099845ea8cb821e6ffb12053800a56ce9c

commit_message:
Enable designate to list on all interfaces

This is a fix to enable designate to listen on all interfaces when the
charm designate is installed on a unit with multiple interfaces.

Change-Id: I96f23532d18550d0e27153d60f1003016958985b
Closes-Bug: #1734156

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: IPVPN OVS driver, advanced options

Mark as advanced some options of OVS driver for IPVPN

Needs an oslo-config version > 4.12, one that will
include Iec6997ee26f618ba6d5250f0597c83b4a3df02cd .

Change-Id: Iddff5108ab64d7045c51daea0dd316c0d44ecb97

(1 comment)

This is a good idea, I just wonder whether ERROR is the appropriate log level.'}, {'account_id': 23874, 'date': '2017-11-22 03:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This is a good idea, I just wonder whether ERROR is the appropriate
 > log level.
SIGHUP signal is very important for users when daemon reloaded, I think it is appropriate to add error log to receive this signal.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2017-11-22 22:31:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Two things:

(1) I'm not saying don't log this, I'm questioning whether ERROR is the appropriate level.  This seems more like an INFO (or arguably WARNING) level message. [0]

(2) Is the point of the message simply that a SIGHUP has been received, or that the config is being reloaded?  If the latter, maybe this message should appear in the reload() function instead.

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/log-guidelines.html#definition-of-log-levels"}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:31:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

I'm totally with Brian here. SIGHUP is definitely not error condition and will not justify error level logging. I'll have a look how we behave now, we should be logging the new config just like in startup so I'd assume we're not silent when this happens. If we really are silent when reloading config on SIGHUB logging is definitely warranted."}]

commit_message:
Add log when receiving SIGHUP signal

As the daemon will reload its configuration files and reopen its
logfiles instead of exiting when receiving SIGHUP signal. So we
need some necessary logs about this event.

Change-Id: I8e5f11058bd26542a52f2fc0063ccdafccf53946

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-22 17:34:41.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Use local facts for MariaDB status

Instead of using a series of set facts, CLI outputs
and a module, use local facts to check the MariaDB
status.

Change-Id: If189a8192f22aafb168587361ca8e6903c918697
'}, {'created': '2017-09-27 18:52:15.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Revise role using dynamic facts

Instead of using a series of set facts, CLI outputs
and a module, use local facts to check the MariaDB
status.

The desired outcome is to radically simplify the
role, while retaining the same functionality.

TODO:
- get it working for Ubuntu
- get it working for CentOS/SuSE
- write up release notes

Change-Id: If189a8192f22aafb168587361ca8e6903c918697
'}, {'created': '2017-11-16 22:38:35.000000000', 'message': 'Tune-up the galera role for efficiency

The galera server role has quite a bit going on within it and because of
recent improvements in Ansible we can make better use of tasks, blocks,
facts, local facts, and organization. This change tunes the role up
following some of our better/more modern patterns allowing the role to
not only be more efficient but also easier to understand.

Change-Id: If189a8192f22aafb168587361ca8e6903c918697
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-11-16 22:39:44.000000000', 'message': 'Tune-up the galera role for efficiency

not only be more efficient but also easier to understand.

commit_message:
Tune-up the galera role for efficiency

The galera server role has quite a bit going on within it and because of
recent improvements in Ansible we can make better use of tasks, blocks,
facts, local facts, and organization. This change tunes the role up
following some of our better/more modern patterns allowing the role to
not only be more efficient but also easier to understand and improves
the roles idempotency.

Change-Id: If189a8192f22aafb168587361ca8e6903c918697
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use gnocchi-api binary for wsgi script

WSGI script gnocchi/rest/app.wsgi has been removed in [1] which has
been included in release 4.1.0 and gnocchi-api must be used instead [2].

Note that new version has been bumped in RDO but not ubuntu yet, so
this patch is switching the wsgi script only for Red Hat deployments.

[1] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/commit/cef3396908947b6a8437476c899e6d5cec48a6d5#diff-f6608875dec4d7646c38d649181fd350
[2] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/blob/176c1332f6279dfa3a8238c9e017769553e59f02/releasenotes/notes/wsgi-script-deprecation-c6753a844ca0b411.yaml

Change-Id: Ibf901844e8319eec9c60f7c5c27770c89aae6427
Closes-Bug: #1735118

[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-17 12:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2017-11-17 12:20:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-17 15:09:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

testing tripleo CI via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521100/'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-18 23:08:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Workflow

It does not do like any tripleo-ci job run introspection any more.. on the bright side, we're not going to break any jobs."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2017-11-20 07:05:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-20 10:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Awesome, introspection is not reporting failures in tripleo CI'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-20 11:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-20 11:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

issue fixed, testing again'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-20 14:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow

recheck

introspection seem to work with this one: http://logs.openstack.org/00/521100/1/check-tripleo/tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq/ea44bd7/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_prep_images.log.txt.gz#_2017-11-20_13_13_56'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-22 13:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Folks, can we please move on with this? We cannot delay the client release forever..'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2017-11-22 13:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-27 12:14:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sorry for mass-adding the cores, but we need to move with the release of ironic-inspector-client, and we don't want to break you. Please review."}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-11-27 13:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-27 13:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-11-27 15:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)

You should be able to add the service_type='baremetal-introspection' arument and it will return a token for the endpoint you need."}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-11-27 15:16:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > You should be able to add the service_type='baremetal-introspection'
 > arument and it will return a token for the endpoint you need.

Sorry. More precisely, you should be able to use the returned tuple as kwargs for the creation of the client. Examples can be seen in HeatAction and GlanceAction. This is an attempt to reduce the redundant implementation of the same functionality for all services.

Though, if you fail to get it working, please let me know and we can proceed to merge this patch.

Thanks for the work!"}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2017-11-29 11:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-29 11:32:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> More precisely, you should be able to use the returned tuple as kwargs for the creation of the client

Mmm, inspector client does not (and should not) accept auth as an argument, that's Session's business. So we need a Session which get_endpoint() will return an endpoint for ironic-inspector.

So what I can do here is:

 kargs = get_session_and_auth('baremetal-introspection')
 new_session = Session(auth=kwargs['auth'])

and then create a client with it. Is it what you'd like to see?"}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2017-11-29 12:18:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

> > More precisely, you should be able to use the returned tuple as
 > kwargs for the creation of the client
 > 
 > Mmm, inspector client does not (and should not) accept auth as an
 > argument, that's Session's business. So we need a Session which
 > get_endpoint() will return an endpoint for ironic-inspector.
 > 
 > So what I can do here is:
 > 
 > kargs = get_session_and_auth('baremetal-introspection')
 > new_session = Session(auth=kwargs['auth'])
 > 
 > and then create a client with it. Is it what you'd like to see?

Best would be if we could apply the same rules for all clients. So far it seemed like most clients accept a `Session` initialized with the keystone url and an `auth` that referred to the service endpoint. Then the client class determined what to do with these.

Part of the reason why ironic has not been updated yet is that the authentication parameters used to be quite different for clients. The current practice has been adopted from the Heat code. (They may be doing stuff otherways today, I haven't checked in a while.)

It would be good if we could avoid adding the `keystoneauth` dependency to this file and tried to extract the auth related logic to the base class. This way we can prevent having to reimplement authentication every time.

Though, I inspected the API a little closer and it probably requires more refactoring to be acceptable for most use cases. At least we tried...

Thank you, Dimitry! Your current solution is probably the best for now."}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2017-11-29 12:20:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Stop passing auth_token to ironic-inspector-client

This has been deprecated long ago, and will be removed really soon.
Create a Token authentication, build a Session and pass it instead.
This reflects how a session was created with auth_token inside the
client previously.

Change-Id: I3ce2916872b6ba4c36d4d6f294456454eee78314

subject: Fix container restart handler
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-29 10:02:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-29 11:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-29 13:31:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nBackport looks good.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 10:02:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix container restart handler

The handler would try and stop a container before restarting it however
if the container was already stopped the handler would fail instead of
simply moving on to the next task. This change makes the "stop" portion
of the task detect the return status code of "2" when restarting the
container. If the return code is "2" we know that the container is
already stopped and that no change has occurred.

For the sake of consistency and to ensure the greatest chance for
success the test task that stops a container has also been given the
same setup.

Change-Id: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff3441c90abbcb76a0f1b2fdf6d60b4ea0854cb2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix container restart handler

The handler would try and stop a container before restarting it however
if the container was already stopped the handler would fail instead of
simply moving on to the next task. This change makes the "stop" portion
of the task detect the return status code of "2" when restarting the
container. If the return code is "2" we know that the container is
already stopped and that no change has occurred.

For the sake of consistency and to ensure the greatest chance for
success the test task that stops a container has also been given the
same setup.

Change-Id: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff3441c90abbcb76a0f1b2fdf6d60b4ea0854cb2)

will complain.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-15 06:59:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add explain of mapping group attribute

As we use federation protocol, assign authorization to ephemeral
users by mapping to groups. Setting this mapping does not add the
ephemeral user to the group and the user is not a member of the group.
Only authorization for the user is same as role assignments to the
group on a project or domain.

This patch add explain about the group mapping

Change-Id: I9faa7d57037af3c2cf6ccfda8d853693fa5eb628

'}]
commit_message:
Add explain of mapping group attribute

As we use federation protocol, assign authorization to ephemeral
users by mapping to groups. Setting this mapping does not add the
ephemeral user to the group and the user is not a member of the group.
Only authorization for the user is same as role assignments to the
group on a project or domain.

This patch add explain about the group mapping

Change-Id: I9faa7d57037af3c2cf6ccfda8d853693fa5eb628

add 'UNKNOWN' status in compute CDM, for compute nodes disabled
not by watcher, so no audit will react on them.
When a node is "disabled", we can use "disabled_reason"(prefix `watcher_`)
to specify the compute nodes disabled by watcher. When building compute CDM,
if the disabled nodes with 'disabled_reason' 'watcher_disabled', we set them
in 'disabled' status, otherwise set them in 'unknown' status.

commit_message:
extend-node-status

add 'disabled_reason' filed into 'ComputeNode' resource, to distinguish
which nodes are disabled by Watcher and which are not by Watcher.

Implements:blueprint extend-node-status

Change-Id: I7175f14870834a4582e45309529d7e8d9fbb2e6f

Dockerhub publisher job

This patchset contains two patches.

1. This patchset includes pushing mechanism for daily periodic jobs.
   (cherry picked from commit c506e626e7443fb95180807013082fb281390376)

2. Fixup small bug with dockerhub publisher

commit_message:
Reduce timer for periodic task tests

With the timer set to 0.1 the execution of the tests depending on that
timer take almost double the time and unnecesarly. There have been cases
of the tests hitting the their wait timeouts when the system is under
load in the CI. By lowering it to 0 we achieve the same testing but
without the delays, hopefully this will reduce the amount of random
failures.

Change-Id: I61bd4a4309e274546fea2616002c4e0cc8a9e37d

Hi Marc!  Thanks for the patch.  While this does achieve the goal of adding an ID property to the responses, I feel that it may not be the best approach.

I think a better approach would be to modify the models themselves instead of making the change across so many different controller methods.

I would prefer if you added the 'id' property to the ModelBase class [1] to avoid having to make so many changes to the controllers.

Once we have that 'id' property we can refactor the convert_to_hrefs() [2] utility function to use it instead of deleting the ENTITY_id properties.  Also the different model's _do_extra_dict_fields() hook methods should be updated to skip adding the ENTITY_id properties to begin with.  For example 'secret_id' in link [3] is added only to be removed later by the convert_to_hrefs function.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/model/models.py#L176
[2] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/common/hrefs.py#L65
[3] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/model/models.py#L1222"}, {'account_id': 8623, 'date': '2017-02-28 16:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hey Marc!

Are you still interested in working on this patch?  If so, please update it to address the feedback. If no, please abandon it.  Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 19554, 'date': '2017-07-13 03:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I think this patch should be abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2017-11-29 12:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add id for API responses

The API response of many barbican action contains only full url.
This url also contains endpoint information that is stored in keystone.
Other API calls like secret delete need just the UUID which is the best
value to identify the entry.

APIImpact

Change-Id: If95242294b01a221708f745b9e6a834d5887619f

[{'created': '2017-10-31 10:53:17.000000000', 'message': "Tempest test_port_security_macspoofing_port was skipped for wrong reason

According to the comment, this test was skipped because it expected
the dhcp interface to be present which is not true. The reason why this
test has to be skipped is because the connection is checked through a
ping command from the spoofed port and replies won't reach the
destination because of the OVN ARP responder: ICMP replies will be sent
to the original MAC address and not to the spoofed one.

Let's continue to skip it until [0] gets fixed.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1728886

commit_message:
Tempest test_port_security_macspoofing_port was skipped for wrong reason

According to the comment, this test was skipped because it expected
the dhcp interface to be present which is not true. The reason why this
test has to be skipped is because the connection is checked through a
ping command from the spoofed port and replies won't reach the
destination because of the OVN ARP responder: ICMP replies will be sent
to the original MAC address and not to the spoofed one.

Let's continue to skip it until [0] gets fixed.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1728886

Change-Id: I3a8d2c04f34eab241350e88f3e0b6f57d3dd37ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 10:59:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix publication of IRC meetings ICS files

During transition to Zuulv3, an error was introduced in the ICS
files publication post-job, resulting in the "calendars" directory
itself to be copied to $path/calendars, instead of the ICS files
present in the directory. ICS files were were therefore being
published to $path/calendars/calendars. This commit restores
publication to $path/calendars.

Change-Id: Ifebd883826341b4d4f21f2f114b0a87582845ab3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix publication of IRC meetings ICS files

During transition to Zuulv3, an error was introduced in the ICS
files publication post-job, resulting in the "calendars" directory
itself to be copied to $path/calendars, instead of the ICS files
present in the directory. ICS files were were therefore being
published to $path/calendars/calendars. This commit restores
publication to $path/calendars.

Change-Id: Ifebd883826341b4d4f21f2f114b0a87582845ab3

[{'created': '2017-11-23 13:47:51.000000000', 'message': "Preserve comments in INI files

config_template currently strips comments out from the INI files. This
commit adds support for comments.

The default ConfigParser supports reading comments but it doesn't writes
them back. There are other libraries that have better support for
comments, however, adopting another library would require a bigger
refactor of this code.

Change-Id: I376be69cd2cf34dc147f9ade716791125a424e2c
"}]
commit_message:
Preserve comments in INI files

config_template currently strips comments out from the INI files. This
commit adds support for comments.

The default ConfigParser supports reading comments but it doesn't writes
them back. There are other libraries that have better support for
comments, however, adopting another library would require a bigger
refactor of this code.

Change-Id: I376be69cd2cf34dc147f9ade716791125a424e2c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-19 23:45:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove hard-coded policy choices for creating a server group

The hard-coded choices for the server group policy make it impossible
to create a server group with the soft-affinity or
soft-anti-affinity policy rules which were added in compute API
microversion 2.15. This removes the hard-coded choices so that the
policy is restricted on the server side rather than the client side.

Change-Id: Ib3dc39422ac1015872d56ae2fdeddf0f29613494
Closes-Bug: #1732938
'}]
commit_message:
Remove hard-coded policy choices for creating a server group

The hard-coded choices for the server group policy make it impossible
to create a server group with the soft-affinity or
soft-anti-affinity policy rules which were added in compute API
microversion 2.15. This removes the hard-coded choices so that the
policy is restricted on the server side rather than the client side.

Change-Id: Ib3dc39422ac1015872d56ae2fdeddf0f29613494
Closes-Bug: #1732938

Commit 53a6cce9ed08 ("Use handlers to restart services and move dnsmasq

commit_message:
tasks: lxc_net: Do not source non-existing network script on CentOS

Commit 53a6cce9ed08 ("Use handlers to restart services and move dnsmasq
to a unit file") removed the ifup-post script on CentOS but we are still
sourcing it in the main network script and it's causing problems when
trying to bring the lxcbr0 interface up.

[root@localhost network-scripts]# ifup lxcbr0
RTNETLINK answers: File exists
/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifup-post: line 115: /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifup-post-lxcbr0: No such file or directory

Backport note:
The above-mentioned commit was included in

commit_message:
Ensure net=host pods can use k8s DNS

This change switches the dnsPolicy on net=host pods to ensure they can
access the k8s DNS service. This patch removes the need for the
resolv.conf hack. ClusterFirstWithHostNet is available from kubernetes
version 1.6+.

Change-Id: I4982cd0a44059f84cd609bd9aa2bf69faa6921f6

commit_message:
Add ability to set keepalived virtual_router_id in clouds.yaml

In order to run multiple kolla-k8s deployments in the same environment
when both are running keepalived we need to be able to override the
keepalived virtual_router_id to prevent them conflicting with each
other.

Change-Id: I04b755e6b2631438596886527230cd349571a7ad

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-09-29 09:53:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2017-09-29 16:05:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

I'm trying to get a handle on this ps. The stated goal is to make the system more ha, but the ps seems to be exposing internal details which I think will make things less ha? Can you please explain a little bit more what you are trying to do? Maybe I can help."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-10-02 09:58:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The ironic HA model is based around it's conductors, baremetal nodes are spread among the alive conductors using a hash ring and if a conductor dies/goes offline, the node's it was responsible for are re-balanced onto different conductors and they perform a take over process.

The ironic communication model is a little odd, because its a triangle:

* conductor talks to baremetal server
* baremetal server talks to ironic API,
* ironic API talks to conductor via rabbit

Also every conductor is sidecarred with the TFTP server used for PXE booting the baremetal server, so during PXE there is:

* baremetal server talks to TFTP

During PXE boot the conductor that is in control of the server being PXEed injects the what it knows the Ironic API IP address is into the kernel parameters of the baremetal server.

Provisioning happens on a separate (isolated) network so the ironic API service endpoint can't be the same as the public endpoint for ironic API. Without this patch we'd have to run an additional keepalived instance to move an IP address for the Ironic API around in the provisioning network.

What this patch proposes is to take advantage of the kube-proxy to streamline, simplify and align the k8s communication paths for baremetal with ironic's HA model.

It does this by adding every conductor node's IP address in the provisioning network to the ironic API service external IP addresses list, which causes kube-proxy to go and program a proxy route to the Ironic API on to every conductor node. Now the conductor's can hand out their own IP address for both the Ironic API and the TFTP server locations, which changes the communication paths into:

* conductor talks to baremetal server
* baremetal server talks to conductor IP which proxy to Ironic API service
* ironic API talks to conductor via rabbit

Now all communications to/from that baremetal server goes through the conductor that is responsible for that baremetal server, letting ironic's HA model and conductor load balancing work as expected.

and when/if a conductor dies, then the conductor taking over the nodes from the dead conductor will reissue the ironic API and TFTP location's as the new conductors IP address so now communication will go to the dead conductor node."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-11-29 11:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning until I have time to revisit this or someone else needs it'}]

commit_message:
Add ironic provision network IP addresses to API external IPs

For the ironic baremetal servers to call back to the Ironic API they
need to know where to talk to, to make this HA we should ensure that
each conductor exposes the ironic API on its provisoning network IP
address. To do that this patch allows to specify a list of the conductor
provision network IPs in clouds.yaml so we can add them to the
ironic-api-svc external IPs list.

Change-Id: I4566f6eccf4d74240f0e96e420b285baa2bf06ee

commit_message:
Ensure ironic-inspector declares with ports it binds too

Ensure that we declare which ports inspector binds to, so that the k8s
system can make decisions based on it, also ensure that ironic-inspector
binds to a different port than is specified in the kubernetes service to
prevent conflicts between ironic-inspector and kube-proxy exposing the
services external IP address.

Change-Id: I1fafd15486bda5a41e3c0e28f2acaf14f7642801

commit_message:
[WIP] Put logic in place for using new Ironic network simulation

When the new Ironic network simulation logic becomes available make
sure we use it, because the old way will not work any more.

Change-Id: I6475788aa230bbdb048425d9c1b51404d59a1bef

Hi Thomas. You should always validate the translation import even if there are typo erros.

subject: Make helm charts available in /usr/share
messages:
[{'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-06-16 15:53:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6638, 'date': '2017-06-16 15:55:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6638, 'date': '2017-06-16 15:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This will be useful for useful for deploying with microcharts rather than service charts'}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2017-06-16 15:59:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

On the fence on this one....

The normal way of deploying with helm is with package repo's. ala yum/apt. Something like:

helm repo add kolla https://tarballs.openstack.org/kolla/k8s/ocata
helm install kolla/...

This would work, but doesn't follow the normal helm convention, so may be very intuitive for helm users?"}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-06-16 16:18:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> On the fence on this one....
 > 
 > The normal way of deploying with helm is with package repo's. ala
 > yum/apt. Something like:
 > 
 > helm repo add kolla https://tarballs.openstack.org/kolla/k8s/ocata
 > helm install kolla/...
 > 
 > This would work, but doesn't follow the normal helm convention, so
 > may be very intuitive for helm users?

Is that possible to load the repo like that now or does it require work? I don't think that this change prevents that being possible, this just ensures that if someone pip installs kolla-k8s they have a known location to find the helm charts if they want to install them from the file system, and our current workflow/guide uses file system paths to the charts not a helm repo"}, {'account_id': 9237, 'date': '2017-06-16 16:24:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Is that possible to load the repo like that now or does it require
 > work? I don't think that this change prevents that being possible,
 > this just ensures that if someone pip installs kolla-k8s they have
 > a known location to find the helm charts if they want to install
 > them from the file system, and our current workflow/guide uses file
 > system paths to the charts not a helm repo

We're working towards it with the binary artifacts work. But not done yet.

not sure pip install will work either? currently we are in an intermediate place were we still must use build scripts to build the helm packages. It might need some other work, such as porting the stuff to parent-values to land before its usable."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-16 16:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

commit_message:
Make helm charts available in /usr/share

This patch ensures that the helm charts are made accessible in
/usr/share/kolla-kubernetes when the kolla-kubernetes package is
installed.

Change-Id: I990a9314583bb435f92eefe9da9f0b299829d065

commit_message:
[DNM] Disable iPXE and make sure normal PXE works

This patch is to disable ironic configuring iPXE so that normal PXE is
used for the gate tests.

Change-Id: I1ea993a2be446d3df7c7591e5f7336fee65c912a

i like this. seems well-thought out.

I would ask though, what is the default behaviour when a node is not "Synced" because of a IST, however breif? what does the client typically see?

My worry which may be unfounded is this will down the node in haproxy and potentially break client connections unneccsarily.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-29 06:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> i like this. seems well-thought out.
 > 
 > I would ask though, what is the default behaviour when a node is
 > not "Synced" because of a IST, however breif? what does the client
 > typically see?
 > 
 > My worry which may be unfounded is this will down the node in
 > haproxy and potentially break client connections unneccsarily.

I'm not 100% sure as I've not specifically seen or tested that. Thoughts on how I might fence it?'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-11-29 07:13:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

You are catching donor as the same as sync'd it looks like (at least by default), so thats good. This would y break if you have any active/active database stuff.

But the docs[0] say "the typical return values are Joining, Waiting on SST, Joined, Synced or Donor. In the event that the node is part of a nonoperational component, the return value is Initialized." With a note that reads:

"If the node returns any value other than the one listed here, the state comment is momentary and transient. Check the status variable again for an update."

Now i dont know what those trasient readings are, or if they occur when acting as a donor. So i might suggest either figuring out what those are _or_ saying that anything except "Intialized" is a good state (of finding a balance that we can be 100% sure of the state of the node).

For testing, i would say a long running query/queries and then lots of smaller transactions to help all the force the replication along, seeing if the long queries break. Though that is admittedly race-conditiony.

My historical approach has been "if its listening on 3306 and has Primary wsrep_cluster_status, its a good node". It will go Non-Primary during splits or other issues, and it won't start listening on 3306 until its gone Primary (for those restarted nodes). Maybe simplifying a bit to just checking wsrep_cluster_status might be safer?

[0] http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/monitoringthecluster.html'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-29 09:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-29 10:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 17:47:50.000000000', 'message': "Implement a proper WSREP check for galera

The galera cluster rely on WSREP for cluster consistency. While the
default MySQL monitor will allow us to know when the database node is
minimally functional it does not provide the ability to query the node
state allowing loadbalancers, operators, and deployers to know a node
is healthy prior to being allowed to accept connections. This change
implements the checkcluster script as provided by the fine folks at
Percona. The implementation of this check follows the guild-lines noted
here [0]. With this in-place, we'll be able to convert our haproxy check
for the galera cluster nodes to use an HTTP check on port 9200 instead
of the default MySQL login which will provide for a more robust and
fault tolerant cluster.

[0] https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtradb-cluster/LATEST/howtos/virt_sandbox.html
Closes-Bug: #1665667

Change-Id: Ie1b3b9724dd33de1d90634166e585ecceb1f4c96
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Implement a proper WSREP check for galera

The galera cluster rely on WSREP for cluster consistency. While the
default MySQL monitor will allow us to know when the database node is
minimally functional it does not provide the ability to query the node
state allowing loadbalancers, operators, and deployers to know a node
is healthy prior to being allowed to accept connections. This change
implements the checkcluster script as provided by the fine folks at
Percona. The implementation of this check follows the guild-lines noted
here [0]. With this in-place, we'll be able to convert our haproxy check
for the galera cluster nodes to use an HTTP check on port 9200 instead
of the default MySQL login which will provide for a more robust and
fault tolerant cluster.

[0] https://www.percona.com/doc/percona-xtradb-cluster/LATEST/howtos/virt_sandbox.html
Closes-Bug: #1665667

Change-Id: Ie1b3b9724dd33de1d90634166e585ecceb1f4c96
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 12:50:56.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent apache from listening on default ports

This fixes an issue where the containers used for TLS proxy would
listen on the same port and thus fail to start with:

(98)Address already in use: AH00072: make_sock: could not bind to
address [::]:80
(98)Address already in use: AH00072: make_sock: could not bind to
address 0.0.0.0:80

This change applies the same logic that Kolla does for containers
images with apache in it:

https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/31259fa595392c25a5e21d03c13e8896648a7695/docker/heat/heat-base/Dockerfile.j2#L20-L21
https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/31259fa595392c25a5e21d03c13e8896648a7695/docker/heat/heat-base/extend_start.sh#L10-L21

Change-Id: Ic2fd3f65b06755ae0869af7b39bcdbcb8ec03774
Closes-Bug: #1734879

commit_message:
Prevent apache from listening on default ports

This fixes an issue where the containers used for TLS proxy would
listen on the same port and thus fail to start with:

(98)Address already in use: AH00072: make_sock: could not bind to
address [::]:80
(98)Address already in use: AH00072: make_sock: could not bind to
address 0.0.0.0:80

This change applies the same logic that Kolla does for containers
images with apache in it:

https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/31259fa595392c25a5e21d03c13e8896648a7695/docker/heat/heat-base/Dockerfile.j2#L20-L21
https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/31259fa595392c25a5e21d03c13e8896648a7695/docker/heat/heat-base/extend_start.sh#L10-L21

Change-Id: Ic2fd3f65b06755ae0869af7b39bcdbcb8ec03774
Closes-Bug: #1734879

commit_message:
Switch to RDO Queens baseurl in overcloud upgrade

Dependencies are maintained in trunk.rdoproject.org
starting with Queens as stated in [1]. Therefore, it
is necessary to modify the repo used to upgrade the
overcloud.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508870/

Change-Id: Id53b609ff6f31e1da96598c180151239be287242

commit_message:
Clean fluentd_plugins_install block

fluentd_plugins_install should contain only plugin installation operations,
so that the override does not have to handle irrelevant operations

Change-Id: I8f810d194a1e638683df1f445c187b8d98629730

[{'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2017-11-20 03:17:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2017-11-20 13:45:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

under what conditions does this error occur?'}, {'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2017-11-21 01:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

when you run an audit with audit_scope the value of audit_scope is passed till here.
https://github.com/openstack/watcher/blob/master/watcher/decision_engine/strategy/strategies/base.py#L181

when get_cluster_data_model is called it reloads a specified CDM
https://github.com/openstack/watcher/blob/master/watcher/decision_engine/model/collector/manager.py#L53

But considering Base CDM is singleton, it returns the same instance each time, and audit_scope value is None, because we load this class at the time of service start also.
https://github.com/openstack/watcher/blob/master/watcher/decision_engine/model/collector/base.py#L122'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2017-11-22 09:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This patch removes 'audit_scope' from __init__ of

commit_message:
Fix Bug Unable to get scoped data model

This patch removes 'audit_scope' from __init__ of
BaseClusterDataModelCollector class, as it is a singleton class
and cannot be instantiate more than once.

A new method is defined in BaseClusterDataModelCollector in place
of property audit_scope_handler, which takes audit_scope as
argument.

Change-Id: I0664c151d71a711c118d43c180d8b0760b1c81fa
Closes-Bug: #1732849

commit_message:
SUSE: Apply workaround for mariadb-10.2

The openSUSE repository bumped the mariadb package to 10.2. However,
there is an upstream bug that prevents nodes from joining the cluster.
The way to workaround it is to export WSREP_SST_OPT_PORT=4444 in the
systemd service file. Moreover, we pull the mariadb-galera subpackage
which contains some necessary tools for galera clusters. Finally,
we drop the default configuration files which are being installed by
the packages because they conflict with the ones installed by this role.

[hwoarang: This also applies the linter fixes from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523080/ in order to make the
gates happy]

Depends-On: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Link: https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-14256
Change-Id: I97cf1585b2fed08f53f62a547547e422bc34fa53

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 01:33:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix container restart handler

The handler would try and stop a container before restarting it however
if the container was already stopped the handler would fail instead of
simply moving on to the next task. This change makes the "stop" portion
of the task detect the return status code of "2" when restarting the
container. If the return code is "2" we know that the container is
already stopped and that no change has occurred.

Change-Id: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-11-29 01:56:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix container restart handler

already stopped and that no change has occurred.

Change-Id: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2017-11-29 02:31:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix container restart handler

The handler would try and stop a container before restarting it however

of the task detect the return status code of "2" when restarting the
container. If the return code is "2" we know that the container is

commit_message:
Fix container restart handler

The handler would try and stop a container before restarting it however
if the container was already stopped the handler would fail instead of
simply moving on to the next task. This change makes the "stop" portion
of the task detect the return status code of "2" when restarting the
container. If the return code is "2" we know that the container is
already stopped and that no change has occurred.

For the sake of consistency and to ensure the greatest chance for
success the test task that stops a container has also been given the
same setup.

Change-Id: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add find-links back to pip.conf

In https://review.openstack.org/522761 the find-links
configuration was mistakenly removed from pip.conf
which results in a broken integrated build. This
returns the configuration back.

Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Change-Id: I578b5eff4f07f0016d000dfb7cc90aa6ed78ed4d
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Split metrology configuration from CK config file

To avoid source code updates with metrology conf update,
the metrology configuration is separated from Cloudkitty
configuration file and placed in a yaml one.

Task: 5724
Story: 2001215

Change-Id: Icc098c40bc52c2589e89d705d9d711d0ce2fb557

commit_message:
Change oslo.messaging prefetch default

In some case, Ceilometer can consume To of RAM. If batch is not enabled
the default behavior is to fetch all messages waiting in the queue.

Since I fail to change/expose this bad oslo.messaging default for us.
This change set a correct default on our side.

Change-Id: I3f4b0ef5fa90afb965e31584b34fdc30a5f4f9f1

[{'created': '2017-11-17 04:01:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix intermitten temptest test failure in dimension and statistics

Test data setup wasn't tested thoroughtly to ensure the data is all
written to db and available for read. This causes test failure due
to write/read timing and sometimes metric create failures. Added
more check and wait in data set up section in the two test classes.

Change-Id: Ia13ecbda1056129d20585cf8dbd7564f31b37c9f
"}, {'created': '2017-11-17 16:04:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix intermitten temptest test failure in dimension and statistics

Test data setup wasn't checked thoroughtly to ensure the data is all
written to db and available for read before executing test cases.
This causes test failure due to write/read timing and sometimes
metric create failures. Added more check and wait in data set up
section in the two test classes.

Change-Id: Ia13ecbda1056129d20585cf8dbd7564f31b37c9f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix intermitten temptest test failure in dimension and statistics

Test data setup wasn't checked thoroughtly to ensure the data is all
written to db and available for read before executing test cases.
This causes test failure due to write/read timing and sometimes
metric create failures. Added more check and wait in data set up
section in the two test classes.

Change-Id: Ia13ecbda1056129d20585cf8dbd7564f31b37c9f

commit_message:
Bump oslo.config to 5.1.0

We fix some bugs recently, for example I962e49c81bdf44043
which is needed by I5261472d29cbdb9ecb8c06f66d5bac060602dd11.

Note we bump major version to 5.0 due to remove parameter enforce_type
in I8a5e868e0adc2c7b6f46f56ee77a8129c34badb9, we have cleaned up its
usage, so it's safe to bump to 5.1.0.

Change-Id: I0119d82f0acc79bd29048f7a15872235858388a4

commit_message:
devstack: Bump the heap size of midonet-cluster

For the latest versions of MidoNet.

Alternatively we can disable topology cache.
But we usually try to enable everything as far as possible here.

Change-Id: I5918d4b8599ab789ed2f681f682c6e8ca90b4951

I don't know enough about the console stuff to know which ones should not be modified, so going to leave this for others to review."}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2016-08-21 22:42:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

What if the IPMI password has already been changed, and the operator needs to update Ironic with that new information while a console session is active?

What if the operator is rolling out an update to the deploy ramdisk image across the fleet, and some Nodes are currently in use by Nova (and have an active console session)? The change to deploy ramdisk image URL and checksum won't have any effect on console or the running instance, and should very much be allowed at this time.

I believe this change paints with too broad a brush. I'm not convinced we need to prevent this in the first place, but if we do, perhaps we should allow the ConsoleInterface to determine whether to allow the change or not."}, {'account_id': 13295, 'date': '2016-08-22 19:04:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I generally agree with Ruby and Devananda's concerns. I see two main problems with disallowing driver_info updates:

1. What if a node gets stuck with the console enabled? You can't update anything in driver_info if that occurs without some kind of manual unsticking. I haven't read all of the console patches, so please let me know if this isn't a valid concern.

2. What if an attacker constantly re-enables console on some nodes? You can't do some mitigation like changing the IPMI password with this happening.

I'm more concerned about 1 than 2.

One other potential option is to allow the driver_info updates that are unrelated to the console to go through, and only partially fail the update."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2016-09-09 08:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow-1

Thanks all, I tend to agree with your concerns.

The main problem as I see it is that most of console driver interfaces return too much properties.

My current idea is to add a top-level method to base console interface, e.g. get_live_console_properties (default returning an empty dict) and let drivers override it whenever there are some properties that indeed can not be changed for a running console.

WDYT?'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2016-09-09 09:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Console driver interface may have some properties that will break a
running console when changed.

This patch adds a new method `get_locked_properties`
in the base console interface class (returns empty dict by default)
that can be overriden in subclasses when console interface
implementation indeed has such properties that should be locked on
running console.

Node updates that change any property in driver_info from those
returned by this new method will be denied when console is enabled
on the node, resulting in HTTP 409 (Conflict) response to API call.

Change-Id: Iceef006ee3140ed558cd31bd9f1fd91502938632
Closes-Bug: #1569254

commit_message:
Deny some driver_info updates when console is on

Console driver interface may have some properties that will break a
running console when changed.

This patch adds a new method `get_locked_properties`
in the base console interface class (returns empty dict by default)
that can be overriden in subclasses when console interface
implementation indeed has such properties that should be locked on
running console.

Node updates that change any property in driver_info from those
returned by this new method will be denied when console is enabled
on the node, resulting in HTTP 409 (Conflict) response to API call.

Change-Id: Iceef006ee3140ed558cd31bd9f1fd91502938632
Closes-Bug: #1569254

Thanks Pavlo, the patch looks good, but I think it's not sufficient.

Even the agent can authenticate with keystone in some way, it still does not know the keystone service url, even the out-of tree code could not utilize this feature just by this patch. And there are works to do in the ipa. I wonder how you define the range of out-of-tree.

But decoupling with swift has great values, in case of resource limits, swift may not be deployed, we need a way to deploy without swift, that is why I am thinking we should request a feature to do it."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-06-30 07:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Wang,

here is the WiP patch for an out-of-tree driver (the ansible-deploy one) that kind of needs this instead of implementing its own version

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444198'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-06-30 07:25:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

TBH there are two points why it won't work today with IPA in a secure enough way:

- no secure channel for communication between conductor and the node
  - IPA does not support SSL on its API currently
  - kind of solved by ansible-deploy as it works thru SSH
- but the bigger problem is possibility of an attacker stealing the ramdisk image and impersonating the node with it. We need a secure way to verify that the node conductor talks to is indeed one of your physucal baremetal nodes, not an impersonated one."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-06-30 08:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2017-06-30 09:41:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> TBH there are two points why it won't work today with IPA in a
 > secure enough way:
 > 
 > - no secure channel for communication between conductor and the
 > node
 > - IPA does not support SSL on its API currently
 > - kind of solved by ansible-deploy as it works thru SSH
 > - but the bigger problem is possibility of an attacker stealing the
 > ramdisk image and impersonating the node with it. We need a secure
 > way to verify that the node conductor talks to is indeed one of
 > your physucal baremetal nodes, not an impersonated one.

I am not sure if I get it right: the real problem is that if we make ironic sending credentials to ipa, the fake node will get it. we can't do it at current situation, only if we can find a way to identify the node.

If that so, it's not an easy task then. We don't have hardware dependent information when a node is enrolled. If here is any possibility for the operator adding hardware identity information or by inspecting the node (like serial number, etc.)? Then IPA can regenerate same identity information from baremetal according to some algorithm and report back to ironic, then we can know it's the node we known."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-30 10:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

commit_message:
Allow to set image_url to glance API file

if the (out-of-tree) ramdisk agent has possibility to authenticate with
Keystone or hold a Keystone token,
it can download image from glance API directly instead of relying
on Swift TempURLs. One example of such ramdisk would be the one used by
the ansible deploy interface, where one could pass auth credentials
to ramdisk via secure SSH connection.

This patch adds a new `tempurl` kwarg to `build_instance_info_for_deploy`
method (defaults to True).
When set to False, generation and validation of a Swift TempURL for image
will be skipped, and the instance_info.image_url field will be set to
`<glance-api-url>/<rest-path-to-image>/file` instead.

Change-Id: I803aa28fcd52e5244c473c90cafb80fb5893c7ee

commit_message:
Use heat-tempest-plugin for integration tests

Note: We still have to change grenade jobs to use
the plugin, before removing the plugin from tree.

Change-Id: Ie63f25e724ed3fbd42adcf5bb2d625c2fec67df1

commit_message:
Limit function memory consumption

- Limit memory utilization of function execution.
- Timeout handling(3 min by default)
- Python runtime improvement

Partially implements: blueprint qinling-container-resource-limitation

Change-Id: I4ea991035a446acf78f8d12991a616f8637f95ec

subject: Use qemu-img in bindep
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-29 00:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-29 01:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-29 04:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 00:56:41.000000000', 'message': 'Use qemu-img in bindep

The qemu-img-ev package comes from the virtualization sig backports.
These stopped getting installed with
I747c2b8754effbc6ec82af3bf7543fd9599a6c14.  I believe that this is
really installing these dependencies for dib to convert the image, and
that works with the standard qemu-img package.

Change-Id: I0c09c54f7ace4ac28942b733cbc6dfe42436ecdc
(cherry picked from commit 23bc245cd01a2dd99c563e1d73e45a5b61410011)
'}]
commit_message:
Use qemu-img in bindep

The qemu-img-ev package comes from the virtualization sig backports.
These stopped getting installed with
I747c2b8754effbc6ec82af3bf7543fd9599a6c14.  I believe that this is
really installing these dependencies for dib to convert the image, and
that works with the standard qemu-img package.

Change-Id: I0c09c54f7ace4ac28942b733cbc6dfe42436ecdc
(cherry picked from commit 23bc245cd01a2dd99c563e1d73e45a5b61410011)

commit_message:
Use qemu-img in bindep

The qemu-img-ev package comes from the virtualization sig backports.
These stopped getting installed with
I747c2b8754effbc6ec82af3bf7543fd9599a6c14.  I believe that this is
really installing these dependencies for dib to convert the image, and
that works with the standard qemu-img package.

Change-Id: I0c09c54f7ace4ac28942b733cbc6dfe42436ecdc
(cherry picked from commit 23bc245cd01a2dd99c563e1d73e45a5b61410011)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 12:02:12.000000000', 'message': "Change RPC dispatcher access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy

The legacy access policy LegacyRPCAccessPolicy allows RPC access
to all callable endpoint methods including private methods
(methods prefixed by '_').  Trove doesn't expose private method,
so need change to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: Ic00a60c47b8e098ac227a4cca93636657207ede8
"}]
commit_message:
Change RPC dispatcher access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy

The legacy access policy LegacyRPCAccessPolicy allows RPC access
to all callable endpoint methods including private methods
(methods prefixed by '_').  Trove doesn't expose private method,
so need change to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: Ic00a60c47b8e098ac227a4cca93636657207ede8

[{'created': '2017-11-16 16:56:27.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release values.
We've found that most projects now require the service package to be
installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely due to
the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

Change-Id: I42b51892af9c9484232645bd1c2d70724f4b1a45
Needed-by: I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release values.
We've found that most projects now require the service package to be
installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely due to
the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

Change-Id: I42b51892af9c9484232645bd1c2d70724f4b1a45
Needed-by: I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8

On Debian and Ubuntu pip install ansible to /usr/local/bin/ansible, whereas
on CentOS the location is /usr/bin/ansible.

Add ansible sudo running entry for Debian family.

Partial-Bug: #1729216
Change-Id: I2b57403128bc103148ae696c219df52590214adc
Signed-off-by: Xinliang Liu <xinliang.liu@linaro.org>

commit_message:
Add ansible sudo running for Debian family

On Debian and Ubuntu pip install ansible to /usr/local/bin/ansible, whereas
on CentOS the location is /usr/bin/ansible.

Add ansible sudo running entry for Debian family.

Partial-Bug: #1729216
Change-Id: I2b57403128bc103148ae696c219df52590214adc
Signed-off-by: Xinliang Liu <xinliang.liu@linaro.org>

[{'created': '2017-11-28 01:56:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Gnocchi support ceph

Based on gnocchi issue #412 [0], cradox is more stable and recommended
to use.

* Add cradox for source and  RHEL family distro binary.
* Ubuntu binary lacks of cradox package, so install from pypi

[0] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/issues/412

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Icf7d6425884fb889d48c786caebbfc7b7050ae8e
Closes-Bug: #1718701
(cherry picked from commit 24f1714a164fb15b1764566d0bb531536ae024d5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Gnocchi support ceph

Based on gnocchi issue #412 [0], cradox is more stable and recommended
to use.

* Add cradox for source and  RHEL family distro binary.
* Ubuntu binary lacks of cradox package, so install from pypi

[0] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/issues/412

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Icf7d6425884fb889d48c786caebbfc7b7050ae8e
Closes-Bug: #1718701
(cherry picked from commit 24f1714a164fb15b1764566d0bb531536ae024d5)

commit_message:
PowerVM Driver: config drive

This change set adds config drive support for the PowerVM nova driver.

Change-Id: Ieaf271d21cd9bd22ec1433d0b30bb4a7158c5707

commit_message:
Remove ceilometerclient from requirements.txt

The Ceilometer datasource driver was removed in [1], and now that
python-ceilometerclient has been officially removed [2] we should
remove it from the requirements, too.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/517527
[2] - https://review.openstack.org/522183

Change-Id: I2e5ef9d4a65c27dc07a9ff4187543c6d9fae0d3a

for a scale_down/node_delete operation.
