revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 10:40:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove 'branches:' lines from .zuul.yaml

These are no longer needed and complicate queue definition
because of inheritance across branches.  Also remove
unnecessary 'voting: false' lines for experimental jobs
since they are by definition non-voting.

Change-Id: Iad5ab15a8166298e5e317d6c822d42c6cbb6e8ab
(cherry picked from commit b0b4684994cd778f4a76c41c102c2ce8ba05c88d)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove 'branches:' lines from .zuul.yaml

These are no longer needed and complicate queue definition
because of inheritance across branches.  Also remove
unnecessary 'voting: false' lines for experimental jobs
since they are by definition non-voting.

Change-Id: Iad5ab15a8166298e5e317d6c822d42c6cbb6e8ab
(cherry picked from commit b0b4684994cd778f4a76c41c102c2ce8ba05c88d)

commit_message:
Remove hdfs job from check queue

In the manila weekly community meeting it was resolved [1]
to remove unmaintained drivers from the check queue to avoid
waste of infrastructure resources and to remove "red noise"
from the gerrit review pages.

Do so for the hdfs driver.  Leave the job defined as it is run
in devstack-hdfs-plugin.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2017-11-02.log.html#t2017-11-02T15:26:17

Change-Id: Ifdd55572e9a2ba243fe074476d9459acaf474f54
(cherry picked from commit a30085cca30e35febfed6efb22f5066502110577)

commit_message:
Remove glusterfs-native job from check queue

In the manila community meeting it was resolved [1]
to remove unmaintained drivers from the check queue
to avoid waste of infrastructure resources and to
remove "red noise" from the gerrit review pages.

Do so for the glusterfs-native driver.  Leave the
job defined as it is run in the experimental queue
and in devstack-glusterfs-plugin.

[1[ http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2017-11-02.log.html#t2017-11-02T15:26:17

Depends-On: I33fa0026670724cb1d7ca047b4948e4110078342
Change-Id: I87f15ee7f73a8b4a16ae0549d0f2fae4b4c23ec2
(cherry picked from commit 4b3172be57e39d7ca3a4be19ccca582ab8a583c6)

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I74b7316ff2c6cb3f0ef7d84b38e445384efc6ad0

Fetch Cinder availability zones list for volume creation

We have to fetch and show Cinder availability zones list during volume
creation and volume creation from image.

(cherry picked from commit b9972f73b008c48618909240665e80550e7fc3ed)

(2 comments)

Thanks for the patch. I'm not a cisco person; might be good to get someone familiar with ucs to review this too."}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2017-11-22 14:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Thank you Ruby for reviewing. Do you know anyone who is familiar with Cisco driver?'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-11-22 16:30:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

@Madhuri. according to our whiteboard [1], Sam Betts is the cisco contact. Although I haven't seen Sam around the past week or two.

[1 around L350, ]https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/IronicWhiteBoard"}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2017-11-23 03:55:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > @Madhuri. according to our whiteboard [1], Sam Betts is the cisco
 > contact. Although I haven't seen Sam around the past week or two.
 > 
 > [1 around L350, ]https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/IronicWhiteBoard

@Ruby, I see a comment on the whiteboard about the library update at L349.
@Sam, could you please review this patch? UcsPythonSDK is deprecated, which is the new library?"}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-11-27 11:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The library used by the UCS driver is deprecated, and no updates to support new parameters can be made, there is ongoing work to replace the deprecated library with the newer supported library, and this code will need to be incorporated into that change instead.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2017-11-29 04:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> The library used by the UCS driver is deprecated, and no updates to
 > support new parameters can be made, there is ongoing work to
 > replace the deprecated library with the newer supported library,
 > and this code will need to be incorporated into that change
 > instead.

@Samb, Thank you for the information. I will leave this patch for now. We can revisit after the new library is supported in Ironic.'}]

commit_message:
Add a timeout for powering on/off a node on Cisco UCS Driver

There is an aditional timeout parameter when powering on/off
an Ironic node that uses Cisco UCS driver.

Change-Id: I3aa189a7359dc38d222dc3d8d9e3e343af8a2a20
Closes-bug: #1732284

subject: Fix installation procedure for heat_policy.json according to Horizon team's advice.
messages: [{'account_id': 25936, 'date': '2017-11-29 01:22:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2017-11-29 01:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2017-11-29 01:40:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nexpect to add translation related steps later'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2017-11-29 03:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 01:22:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix installation procedure for heat_policy.json
according to Horizon team's advice.

I've changed installation procedure as follows.

(before changing)
1. copy heat_policy.json from Heat-Dashboard directory
   to Horizon directory (same as enable files)
2. add orchestration key to POLICY_FILES settings

 (after changing)
 1. just point Heat-Dashboard policy file path
    from POLICY_FILES settings

Change-Id: Idaf2cbfcb716a9aa4c0f43283526302f062ea0a7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix installation procedure for heat_policy.json
according to Horizon team's advice.

I've changed installation procedure as follows.

(before changing)
1. copy heat_policy.json from Heat-Dashboard directory
   to Horizon directory (same as enable files)
2. add orchestration key to POLICY_FILES settings

 (after changing)
 1. just point Heat-Dashboard policy file path
    from POLICY_FILES settings

Change-Id: Idaf2cbfcb716a9aa4c0f43283526302f062ea0a7
